Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
Shellpoint Mortgage Company reported my loan as 120 days delinquent to the credit bureaus. Prior to this, I submitted an application for a VA mortgage modification under the VASP program. The process took approximately five monthsthree times the estimated durationdue to an error attributed to Shellpoint.

During the application period, Shellpoint did not provide written notification that the mortgage would be reported as delinquent. I was verbally informed that no payments would be required while the application was under review. Throughout the five-month review period, no delinquency was reported to the credit bureaus. However, following approval of the modification, Shellpoint reported the mortgage as 120 days late. 

Approximately XXXX months into the process, Shellpoint informed me that the modification was being denied due to a lien on the property. Shellpoint stated that they required first XXXX position to proceed. I confirmed that no XXXX existed and was asked whether I knew a person named XXXX XXXX. I identified him as the previous owner. Shellpoint indicated that the XXXX was related to child support and had been recorded in XXXX. I purchased the property in XXXX, and the presence of a XXXX would have prevented the sale from being approved by VA XXXX. 

I obtained documentation from the XXXX XXXX, TX title office confirming that no XXXX was recorded against the property. The records also showed that the previous owner had no child support obligations or other liens, and that I am the sole owner ( see attached documentation ). I contacted my VA representative, who advised me to reach out to the title company involved in the modification. 

The title company XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX subsidiary of XXXX the original loan assumption. XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, reviewed the information and confirmed that the XXXX was mistakenly attributed to a person with a similar name to the previous owner. She provided a copy of the lien, which confirmed the error ( see attached email ). This documentation was submitted to both Shellpoint and the VA.

The following day, a Shellpoint manager contacted me after multiple prior requests. During the conversation, she asked whether the loan had been assumed. Upon confirmation, she identified the assumption as the source of the issue. She stated that the error had been corrected and that an approval letter would be issued within 30 days. 

Shellpoint did not provide written notice that the mortgage would be reported as delinquent during the XXXX application period. The extended duration of the approval process was due to errors on Shellpoints part. Based on these facts, the XXXX delinquency should be removed from all three credit bureau XXXX XXXX

I am writing to file a formal complaint regarding a serious servicing error on my mortgage account related to my escrow account and property tax payments. This matter has caused significant financial harm due to Newrezs failure to properly execute instructions that were repeatedly confirmed to me.

Following this, my Private Mortgage Insurance ( PMI ) was removed, and I was explicitly informed on multiple phone calls that my escrow account had also been deactivated as well. 
Relying on these confirmations, I continued to pay my property taxes directly, as I had been instructed to do. 
However, nearly a year later, when I logged into my account to make my regular mortgage payment, I discovered that Newrez had paid approximately {$18000.00} in property taxes from an escrow account that should not have been active. These taxes had already been paid by me directly. As a result, this payment was unauthorized, unnecessary, and entirely avoidable had my escrow account been properly removed as confirmed multiple times by Newrez representatives. 
This represents a serious servicing failure, including but not limited to : Failure to properly process and execute my escrow removal request Providing inaccurate and misleading information over multiple calls Making an unauthorized payment on my behalf for an obligation that had already been satisfied Creating a financial discrepancy that I should not be responsible for correcting

I am submitting this complaint regarding NR/SMS/CALs inaccurate and/or unverifiable mortgage credit reporting and failure to correct disputed payment history after notice.

NR/SMS/CAL is furnishing late payment information on my mortgage account that I dispute as inaccurate and unsupported. The reporting of mortgage delinquencies must be based on accurate payment application and complete servicing records. I have disputed these late payments and am requesting documentation-based proof or correction.

Account and Items in Dispute NR/SMS/CAL ( Mortgage ) Acct : XXXX Disputed late payments reported for : XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX I dispute the accuracy, completeness, and reporting basis of these late payment notations.

Basis of Complaint Mortgage servicing errors frequently involve misapplied payments, escrow changes, or the use of suspense/unapplied funds, which can cause incorrect delinquency reporting even when payments were made. NR/SMS/CAL has continued to report the above late payments without providing documentation sufficient to validate the alleged delinquency and the manner in which payments were applied.

To properly substantiate the reporting, NR/SMS/CAL should be able to provide complete records for each disputed month, including : The monthly mortgage statements showing the contractual due date and amount due ( including escrow changes ) ; A complete payment history/transaction ledger showing date received and date posted/applied; A breakdown of payment application ( principal, interest, escrow, fees ) and whether any funds were placed into suspense/unapplied status ; Any servicing notes, notices, or policies relied upon to determine delinquency ; and The exact basis and date the account was first treated as past due for each disputed billing cycle.

Generic verified as accurate responses are not sufficient without documentation demonstrating that the reporting is correct and that the payment history was applied properly.

Sub-issue: An existing modification, forbearance plan, short sale, or other loss mitigation relief
Consumer complaint narrative:
This is a formal follow-up Notice of Error and Request for Information under 12 C.F.R. 1024.35 and 1024.36. It responds to your certified letter stating that my prior loss-mitigation applications were not processed due to missing documents and that certain investor guidelines are confidential.

Your response contains multiple errors that require correction.

1. NOTICE OF ERROR Failure to Provide Timely Missing-Document Notices You claim that my loss-mitigation applications were not processed because documents were missing.

This is incorrect.

Under 12 C.F.R. 1024.41 ( b ) ( 2 ) ( i ) ( B ), servicers must notify a borrower of missing documents within five ( 5 ) business days of receiving the application.

You did not provide timely missing-document notices.

You instead waited months, then retroactively claimed documents were missing. This is a servicing error under 12 C.F.R. 1024.35 ( b ) ( 11 ) ( any other error relating to loss mitigation ). 
I dispute your claim and request : Copies of every missing document notice you allege was sent The dates they were generated XXXX of delivery The specific documents you claim were missing for each submission. 

XXXX. NOTICE OF ERROR Premature or Improper Closing of My Applications My loss-mitigation review was repeatedly closed despite my submitting requested documents. 
Provide : All internal notes, time stamps, and codes relating to each application closure The reason code used The date you determined my application incomplete The date you claim you requested additional documentation. 
This is required under 1024.36 ( d ) because it directly pertains to the servicing of my account.

3. REQUEST FOR INFORMATION Investor Identity and Criteria Your letter refused to provide investor guidelines on the basis that they are confidential.

That statement is misleading and incomplete.

Under 12 C.F.R. 1024.36 ( d ), you must provide any information that pertains to the servicing of my mortgage loan, including : The identity of the investor ; The specific eligibility criteria applied to my loan ; The exact investor restriction ( s ) you claim made me ineligible for other loss mitigation programs ; A written explanation of how those restrictions apply to my financial documents.

I am again requesting this information.

You may withhold proprietary manuals, but you can not withhold : investor name the rules used the eligibility criteria applied the reason I was denied the calculations used in your determination These are all required disclosures.

4. REQUEST FOR INFORMATION Calculations for the Proposed Modification You offered an unaffordable step-rate modification beginning at 9 %, increasing to 12 %, capitalizing over {$22000.00}, and imposing a {$46000.00} balloon. 
You did not provide : The calculations used ; The affordability analysis ; The internal model output used to determine these terms. 
I request all documents, data, and system notes used to generate the proposed terms.

5. REQUEST FOR CORRECTION AND FULL RE-EVALUATION Because your notices were untimely and your determinations incomplete, I request : 1. Correction of your servicing records reflecting that I did not fail to provide required documents ; 2. A full, good-faith loss-mitigation review compliant with Regulation X ; 3. A written response within the RESPA-required timelines. 

Please send your full written response to : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
IMMINENT HARM Orphan Servicing, Denied Ownership, and Void Loan Enforcement by XXXX XXXX XXXX NewRez LLC XXXX Shellpoint Mortgage Servicing Product and Company Product : XXXX residential mortgage Companies involved : NewRez LLC d/b/a Shellpoint Mortgage Servicing Shellpoint Mortgage Servicing XXXX XXXX XXXX ( alleged parent of NewRez LLC ) What happened I am a 100 % permanent and total XXXX veteran with a XXXX-backed mortgage that is being serviced by NewRez LLC / Shellpoint Mortgage Servicing, which publicly claims to be owned by XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX However, in multiple written responses to my CFPB complaints, these entities have denied ownership, denied parent-subsidiary status, and denied servicing responsibility, effectively placing my loan into what I will call orphan status. 

An orphan loan is one where the claimed servicer and the alleged parent/owner explicitly disclaim any ownership, authority, or legal linkage over the loan, while still attempting to collect payments and threaten foreclosure. That is exactly what is happening here. 

1. Conflicting ownership and wrong company responses XXXX XXXX represents in SEC filings and public investor materials that NewRez LLC and Shellpoint are its wholly owned subsidiaries and key servicing platforms generating its mortgage servicing income. 
In contrast, my CFPB complaint responses from XXXXNewRez/Shellpoint repeatedly state wrong company, we dont service this loan, or deny that XXXX is the parent of NewRez and that NewRez/Shellpoint are related entities, despite those SEC and investor representations.

NewRez/Shellpoint have also denied servicing responsibility or legal ownership while still sending me mortgage statements, default/collection notices, and threats tied to foreclosure. 

These positions can not all be true. If XXXX is not the parent and NewRez/Shellpoint deny linkage, then no entity in this chain is acknowledging legal ownership or authority to enforce my promissory note and deed of trust. That creates an orphan loan with no valid party entitled to enforce it. 

2. Orphan status = no standing to collect or foreclose Under mortgage and UCC principles, a party may only enforce a negotiable promissory note and secured deed of trust if it is a person entitled to enforce the note ( XXXX ) or an authorized agent for such a person. Courts have held that : A foreclosure is invalid if brought by a party that does not hold the mortgage or can not demonstrate a valid assignment at the time of foreclosure ( XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ). 
A creditor or servicer must prove it is the party entitled to enforce the note and related security instrument to have standing ( XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 

Here, NewRez/Shellpoint and XXXX have , in writing to the CFPB, disclaimed parentage, ownership, and servicing authority while still attempting to bill and collect from me. If they are not the owner, not the parent, and not even the correct company, then they are not the XXXX, not a lawful mortgagee, and have no standing to collect, report, or foreclose on my XXXX  mortgage. 

3. Servicing while denying ownership is an unfair, deceptive, and abusive practice ( UDAAP ) Despite denying ownership and linkage : NewRez/Shellpoint continue to accept and demand monthly mortgage payments. 
They continue to send account statements, collection notices, and foreclosure-related communications. 
They continue to manipulate ledgers and escrow while refusing to correctly acknowledge who actually owns or has authority over my loan.

Under the Consumer Financial Protection Act, it is unlawful for covered persons or service providers to engage in unfair, deceptive, or abusive acts or practices in connection with consumer financial products or services. 

Servicing a loan while simultaneously denying any ownership, parentage, or servicing responsibility is : Unfair : It causes substantial injury ( threats of foreclosure, misapplied payments, emotional and financial harm ) that consumers can not reasonably avoid and that has no legitimate countervailing benefit. 
Deceptive : Consumers are misled as to who owns their loan, who is authorized to collect, and who has authority to modify or foreclose. 
Abusive : Consumers reasonably rely on the servicer and parent company to act in their interest, while those entities exploit that reliance by collecting on a loan they disclaim authority to enforce. 

This is especially abusive against me as a 100 % permanent and total XXXX veteran with a XXXX loan. 

4. RESPA / Regulation X violations from error notices about ownership and mis-servicing I have repeatedly given written and electronic notice of serious servicing errors, including : Conflicting loan balances and ledgers Misapplied or unapplied funds Receipt of another borrowers foreclosure financial documents ( clear data/servicing contamination ) Contradictions in who owns/controls my loan Threats of foreclosure while these issues remained unresolved Under Regulation Xs error resolution procedures, any written notice asserting an error in the servicing of a mortgage loan is a notice of error, and the servicer must investigate and either correct the error or provide a written explanation with supporting documents. 

Instead, NewRez/ShellpointXXXX : Responded with wrong company or ownership denials instead of resolving the core error. 
Continued to bill, collect, and threaten foreclosure while those ownership and ledger errors remained outstanding. 

Servicing a loan as if they are the owner/authorized servicer while simultaneously telling the CFPB they are not the owner/parent/servicer is a continuing Regulation X violation and a UDAAP. 

5. Systemwide risk : every NewRez/Shellpoint/XXXX  loan similarly affected is potentially unenforceable Because XXXX touts NewRez and Shellpoint as its core servicing platforms in SEC filings and investor presentations, yet NewRez/Shellpoint and XXXX have used wrong company and ownership-denial language in CFPB responses, the orphan-servicing problem is not just about my loan. It appears systemic. 

If NewRez and Shellpoint deny linkage to XXXX and deny ownership/servicing responsibility in formal responses while still collecting on loans, then : Every loan they service under this structure is at risk of orphan status. 
Every borrower in that situation is being subjected to potentially illegal collections, escrow manipulations, and foreclosure threats without a lawfully identified owner or XXXX. 
XXXX is being enriched by servicing income and cash flows from loans that, based on their own statements, they deny owning or legally controlling. 

This raises systemic UDAAP and RESPA concerns across the entire Rithm/NewRez/Shellpoint servicing book, not just my account. 



What I want the CFPB to do For my individual loan : Determine that, based on the companies own written denials of ownership, parentage, and servicing responsibility, NewRez/Shellpoint/XXXX  do not have standing or authority to collect, report, or enforce my mortgage. 
Treat my loan as legally unenforceable by these entities and require them to : Immediately cease all collection activity, including billing, phone calls, letters, and credit reporting. 
Immediately cease any foreclosure activity or threats, including acceleration notices or foreclosure referrals. 
Provide a full chain-of-title and XXXX verification, identifying the true owner or stating on the record that no lawful owner/servicer can be identified. 
Correct all tradeline reporting and remove any negative credit information they have furnished while denying ownership/authority. 

For systemic relief : Open a supervisory and enforcement investigation into XXXX XXXX, NewRez LLC, and Shellpoint Mortgage Servicing for : Collecting and foreclosing on loans where they have denied ownership, parentage, or servicing responsibility in CFPB responses or other regulatory communications. 
Violating RESPA/Regulation X servicing rules and the CFPBs UDAAP authority by operating orphan servicing platforms. 
Require these entities to : Identify and remediate every loan where a borrower is being serviced or foreclosed upon by an entity that has denied ownership/linkage. 
Cease all collections and foreclosure activity on such loans until a lawful owner/XXXX and agency authority are documented and disclosed to affected consumers. 
Provide restitution, fee refunds, and credit repair for borrowers who were billed, defaulted, or foreclosed upon by an entity that denied ownership or servicing authority. 
Consider civil money penalties and injunctive relief to ensure that XXXX/NewRez/Shellpoint can not continue to operate an orphan-servicing model that enriches XXXX on loans it disclaims. 

As a XXXX veteran with a XXXX loan, I am asking the CFPB to treat this as a high-priority matter affecting not only my home, but potentially thousands of other borrowers ( including servicemembers and veterans ) whose mortgages may already be in the same unlawful orphan status. 



Citation matrix ( APA-style ) Consumer Financial Protection Act UDAAP 12 U.S.C. 5531 & 5536 ( prohibiting unfair, deceptive, or abusive acts or practices in connection with consumer financial products or services ). 

RESPA / Regulation X servicing error and loss mitigation duties Real Estate Settlement Procedures Act, 12 U.S.C. 26012617.

12 C.F.R. 1024.35 ( error resolution procedures ; servicer must investigate and correct or reasonably explain errors, including servicing and payment application problems ).

12 C.F.R. 1024.41 ( loss mitigation procedures ; prohibits certain foreclosure activity while issues remain unresolved ).

Standing/ person entitled to enforce the note ( XXXX ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( servicer/creditor must be a person entitled to enforce the note under the UCC to have standing ). 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  ( foreclosures invalid where foreclosing entities could not prove they held the mortgage at the time of sale ).

UDAAP interpretive guidance CFPB Policy Statement on Abusive Acts or Practices ( XXXX ). 
FDIC/NCUA guidance summarizing unfair, deceptive, or abusive acts and practices.

Sub-issue: An existing modification, forbearance plan, short sale, or other loss mitigation relief
Consumer complaint narrative:
Please see attached rebuttal to complaint XXXX, outlining all the violations.

Thank you for reviewing my complaint. I am submitting this rebuttal because Shellpoint 's response contains significant inaccuracies, omissions, and unresolved issues. Their response does not address the core problems, and the servicing errors remain ongoing. I respectfully request that CFPB re-open my complaint for further investigation.

1. SHELLPOINT 'S RESPONSE OMITS KEY FACTS AND FAILS TO ADDRESS DOCUMENTED ERRORS Several major issues remain unresolved : ( a ) Payments were rejected and returned after my loss mitigation application was acknowledged as complete.

Shellpoint 's letter dated XX/XX/XXXX states my application was complete and foreclosure protection was in place. After that date : Multiple weekly payments were rejected One payment was returned by check ( XX/XX/XXXX payment rejected XX/XX/XXXX ) Additional payments attempted through my bank were rejected These payment rejections are not addressed anywhere in Shellpoint 's response.

( b ) Payment rejection pattern demonstrates bad faith Timeline of Shellpoint 's inconsistent conduct : XX/XX/XXXX - XX/XX/XXXX : Accepted my weekly {$170.00} payments XX/XX/XXXX : Rejected payments and referred loan to foreclosure attorney XX/XX/XXXX : Resumed accepting payments XX/XX/XXXX : Rejected payments again ( starting with XX/XX/XXXX payment, rejected XX/XX/XXXX ) This pattern prevents me from curing any actual delinquency and demonstrates Shellpoint 's bad faith in servicing my account.

2. XXXX ADMITS ( AND SHELLPOINT INHERITED ) SYSTEMATIC ACCOUNTING ERRORS FROM XXXX Shellpoint 's XX/XX/XXXX response specifically acknowledges errors made by the prior servicer ( XXXX  ) : " Errors were found in the construction of your XXXX-approved loan modification during XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX '' " Payments received between XX/XX/XXXX, and XX/XX/XXXX, XXXXprior to the modification being bookedwere not applied according to the modification terms, contributing to further delinquency '' While these errors occurred under XXXXXXXX XXXX servicing ( before Shellpoint took over in XX/XX/XXXX ), Shellpoint : Inherited an account with known errors Took responsibility for these errors in their CFPB response Has NOT corrected the errors Is attempting to foreclose based on a delinquency created by these admitted errors Within 8 months of taking over servicing ( XX/XX/XXXX - XX/XX/XXXX ), Shellpoint filed a Notice of Default without : Correcting the inherited accounting errors Providing accurate accounting of my payments Giving me fair opportunity to cure any actual shortfall Properly crediting my payments made under Shellpoint 's servicing CRITICAL : The alleged delinquency that Shellpoint is foreclosing on was created by XXXXXXXX XXXX admitted errors , which Shellpoint has failed to correct.

3. SHELLPOINT INCONSISTENTLY APPLIED THE XXXX MODIFICATION PARTIAL IMPLEMENTATION IS EVIDENCE THE MODIFICATION WAS ACTIVE Although Shellpoint claims the modification was not implemented, their own records and my current loan terms show : My current interest rate ( 4.125 % ) is the same rate contained in the XXXX modification My current monthly payment amount ( {$660.00} ) matches the XXXX modification payment exactly This indicates Shellpoint did implement parts of the modification, contradicting their written statement. Partial implementation is a recognized form of contract acceptance and raises serious concerns about the accuracy of their foreclosure basis.

Moreover, I have been making payments in good faith reliance on the modification agreement since XX/XX/XXXX. 
4. PRINCIPAL BALANCE FIGURES ARE INCONSISTENT AND UNEXPLAINED Shellpoint 's letter lists contradictory principal balance figures : Loan history principal : {$110000.00} My loan history downloaded from Shellpoint 's system shows : {$110000.00} ( as of XX/XX/XXXX ) My XXXX modification agreement states : {$110000.00} Shellpoint 's XXXX proposed modification lists : {$120000.00} These figures contradict each other by more than {$10000.00} with no explanation.

Shellpoint provided no breakdown of : Which fees were capitalized Why the balance increased by $ XXXX despite payments made What calculations were used Whether misapplied payments from XXXX were corrected How the 13-year draw period error affected the balance This is directly responsive to my RESPA Notice of Error, yet they did not provide the required explanation under 12 U.S.C. 2605 ( e ).

5. SHELLPOINT CONFIRMS THE DRAW PERIOD WAS INCORRECTLY RECORDED Their letter states their system incorrectly showed the draw period ending XX/XX/XXXX, when it actually ended XX/XX/XXXX ( per my original HELOC terms : 60-month draw period from XX/XX/XXXX ). 
Shellpoint claims they corrected the draw period end date to XX/XX/XXXX after I brought it to their attention. This is STILL WRONG. My original HELOC agreement shows a 60-month ( 5-year ) draw period starting XX/XX/XXXX. Correct draw period end date : XX/XX/XXXX ( not XXXX, not XXXX ). 
This means : The loan was serviced with fundamentally incorrect information Payments may have been applied as " draw period '' ( interest-only ) when they should have been applied to principal Possible over-accrual of interest occurred The XXXX modification calculations may have been based on incorrect principal balance Their accounting is demonstrably unreliable Even Shellpoint 's `` correction '' to XX/XX/XXXX is still wrong by 5 years This directly impacts the accuracy of the principal balance, arrears calculation, and modification terms, yet Shellpoint provided no explanation of : How this error affected payment application Whether they recalculated the balance What my principal balance should actually be with correct payment application Whether the modification balance of {$110000.00} was calculated using the wrong draw period assumption 6. SHELLPOINT DID NOT RESPOND TO MULTIPLE REQUIRED RESPA/RFI ITEMS My Notice of Error and Request for Information requested : Full itemization of arrears with dates and amounts Payment-by-payment transaction history showing application to principal, interest, fees Itemization of capitalized amounts Explanation for conflicting principal balances Documentation related to rejected payments All internal servicing notes regarding the XXXX modification Complete accounting from XX/XX/XXXX to present Explanation of how bankruptcy trustee payments were applied Shellpoint did not provide or address these items. Regulation X ( 12 C.F.R. 1024.35 ) requires a substantive response to a Notice of Error. Their response is incomplete and does not satisfy their legal obligations under RESPA.

7. SHELLPOINT 'S DENIAL OF DUAL TRACKING IS CONTRADICTED BY THE PAYMENT REJECTIONS AND TIMELINE Shellpoint claims foreclosure proceedings were paused during loss mitigation review. However, the timeline contradicts this : XX/XX/XXXX : Loan servicing transferred to Shellpoint XX/XX/XXXX : Shellpoint refers loan to foreclosure attorney ( per their letter ) XX/XX/XXXX : Notice of Default recorded XX/XX/XXXX : Shellpoint acknowledges my loss mitigation application is complete After XX/XX/XXXX : Shellpoint rejects multiple payments XX/XX/XXXX : Shellpoint sends CFPB response claiming delinquency Rejecting payments while a loss mitigation application is under review : ( 1 ) Prevents the borrower from curing any delinquency ( 2 ) Causes the alleged arrears to grow ( 3 ) Constitutes advancement of foreclosure proceedings ( 4 ) Violates the dual tracking prohibition under California Civil Code 2923.6 and Regulation X 8. SHELLPOINT FABRICATED A LOSS MITIGATION APPLICATION- I MADE NO SUCH APPLICATION Shellpoint 's XX/XX/XXXX letter states I submitted a complete loss mitigation application as of XX/XX/XXXX. 
THIS IS CATEGORICALLY FALSE. 
In XX/XX/XXXX, my ONLY contact with Shellpoint was : - Making my regular weekly {$170.00} bill pay payments - Payments made through my bank 's automated bill pay system - No other communication of any kind I did NOT in XX/XX/XXXX : - Submit any loss mitigation application ( online, mail, fax, or in person ) - Call Shellpoint to request loss mitigation - Email Shellpoint about loss mitigation - Send any documents to Shellpoint- Authorize anyone to apply on my behalf - Log into any Shellpoint online portal - Sign any application forms I have bank records proving my only activity was routine bill pay payments. Shellpoint fabricated this application. Why would Shellpoint do this?

1. To create appearance of regulatory compliance : By claiming to 'evaluate ' me for loss mitigation, they appear to comply with regulations requiring servicers to consider alternatives to foreclosure.

2. To justify quick denial : They could 'evaluate ' the fake application and deny it ( XX/XX/XXXX ), claiming they considered alternatives.

3. To justify payment rejections : While 'evaluating ' the fake application, they rejected my payments ( starting XX/XX/XXXX ), increasing alleged arrears.

4. To avoid honoring my XX/XX/XXXX modification : By treating me as a new applicant rather than someone with an existing modification.

TIMELINE OF FABRICATED APPLICATION SCHEME : - XX/XX/XXXX : Shellpoint determines application complete - XX/XX/XXXX : Shellpoint sends letter acknowledging application and telling me to continue to make your monthly payments - XX/XX/XXXX : I make my regular weekly {$170.00} payment ( following their XX/XX/XXXX instruction ) - XX/XX/XXXX : Shellpoint REJECTS my XX/XX/XXXX payment. Shellpoint also cuts me a check for my XX/XX/XXXX payment ( 5 days after telling me to make payments ). 
- XX/XX/XXXX : Shellpoint denies fabricated application ( only 14 days later ) - XX/XX/XXXX : Shellpoint tells CFPB they're in compliance with regulations This is fraud. Shellpoint : 1. Fabricated an application I never submitted 2. Used it to create false paper trail 3. Rejected my payments immediately after acknowledging the fake application 4. Quickly denied the application they fabricated 5. Used this charade to advance foreclosure while claiming regulatory compliance I request CFPB investigate : 1. What application Shellpoint claims to have received XX/XX/XXXX 2. What documents they claim I submitted 3. How I allegedly submitted this application 4. Whether Shellpoint has any record of actual communication from me in XX/XX/XXXX 5. Whether Shellpoint has engaged in this practice with other borrowers Shellpoint can not foreclose based on fabricated applications and manufactured denials.

9. SHELLPOINT VIOLATED ITS OWN WRITTEN INSTRUCTION TO MAKE PAYMENTS Timeline of Shellpoint 's contradictory conduct : XX/XX/XXXX : Shellpoint sends letter stating : - My alleged application grants me protection from foreclosure - I should continue to make monthly payments according to your loan agreement XX/XX/XXXX : Following Shellpoint 's written instruction, I made my regular weekly {$170.00} payment via bill pay ( as I had been doing for years ). 
XX/XX/XXXX : Shellpoint REJECTED/RETURNED my XX/XX/XXXX payment.

This means : 1. Shellpoint instructed me in writing to make payments ( XX/XX/XXXX ) 2. I made a payment in direct reliance on that instruction ( XX/XX/XXXX ) 3. Shellpoint rejected the payment I made following their instruction ( XX/XX/XXXX ) 4. This occurred during the alleged 'evaluation period ' when foreclosure protection supposedly applied Shellpoint can not : - Tell me to make payments in writing - Reject payments I make following those instructions - Use rejected payments to justify foreclosure - Claim I'm not paying when they won't accept payments The 5-day gap between payment submission ( XX/XX/XXXX ) and rejection ( XX/XX/XXXX ) proves this was a deliberate, affirmative decision by Shellpoint to reject my payment during the evaluation period.

This demonstrates : - The evaluation was a sham with predetermined denial - Payment rejection was part of scheme to increase arrears- Shellpoint 's bad faith in servicing my account This XX/XX/XXXX payment was part of my consistent pattern of weekly payments I had been making for years. I was continuing my established payment schedule in compliance with both my XX/XX/XXXX modification and Shellpoint 's XX/XX/XXXX written instruction.

Shellpoint 's rejection of this payment - made in direct response to their written directive - is evidence of bad faith, breach of their own instructions, and advancement of foreclosure during a supposed evaluation period.

10. SHELLPOINT FAILED TO ADDRESS CRITICAL PAYMENT INFORMATION My complaint specifically detailed the payments I made, which Shellpoint completely ignored : I MAKE WEEKLY PAYMENTS I make payments of {$170.00} per week ( not monthly ), which equals MORE than the required {$660.00} monthly payment.

Looking at Shellpoint 's loan history statement : - Multiple {$170.00} entries per month clearly show weekly payment pattern - I was CONSISTENTLY OVERPAYING the required amount - Yet principal balance remained flat at around {$110000.00} for 20+ months This proves Shellpoint could not properly handle weekly payments and failed to : 1. Apply the extra to principal 2. Properly credit weekly payments as they were received 3. Notify me if weekly payments caused processing issues I was paying EXTRA to reduce my debt faster. Shellpoint 's system failure in handling weekly payments should not result in foreclosure.

TOTAL PAYMENTS MADE SINCE MODIFICATION ( XX/XX/XXXX - XX/XX/XXXX ) : My post-modification principal balance was {$110000.00}, which included all arrears, fees, and advances up to that date I paid {$16000.00} of the required down payments of {$15000.00} ( {$930.00} over required ) I paid payments totaling {$10000.00} between XXXX and when Shellpoint improperly stopped accepting payments.

The bankruptcy trustee made additional payments totaling {$7600.00} ( XXXX ) I resumed weekly payments on XX/XX/XXXX and paid {$4600.00} up until Shellpoint improperly stopped accepting payments.

TOTAL PAYMENTS : {$39000.00} According to modification, these are the facts, REQUIRED PAYMENTS : Down payment : {$15000.00} Monthly payments ( 42 months {$660.00} ) : {$28000.00} TOTAL REQUIRED : {$43000.00} ACTUAL SHORTFALL, including months of rejected payments ( if all payments properly applied ) : Approximately {$4400.00} This represents approximately 6-7 months of payments - a manageable amount that I should have been given clear opportunity to cure.

Instead, Shellpoint : Claims I am delinquent from XX/XX/XXXX Has not explained where my {$39000.00} in payments went Refuses to provide an accurate accounting Rejects my attempts to continue making payments I have paid {$39000.00} in good faith to perform under the modification. Shellpoint 's failure to properly apply these payments created the alleged delinquency.

11. ADDITIONAL VIOLATIONS NOT ADDRESSED IN SHELLPOINT 'S RESPONSE ( a ) Harassment from Third-Party Solicitors Since the Notice of Default was filed on XX/XX/XXXX, multiple third-party solicitors have been calling my adult children regarding this debt. These unsolicited calls have caused additional stress and embarrassment to my family. While Shellpoint may not be directly making these calls, the filing of the NOD made my personal financial situation public record, leading to this harassment.

( b ) Documented Emotional Distress and Harassment The stress from Shellpoint 's conduct has caused severe documented harm : Emergency room visit for XXXX XXXX ( thought I was having a XXXX XXXX ) Ongoing physical symptoms including chest pains and ulcer-like symptoms Constant phone calls, mail, and door knocking Public humiliation from foreclosure notice posted on XXXX Harassment of my children Shellpoint 's response shows no acknowledgment of the harm their admitted errors have caused.

( c ) California Homeowner Bill of Rights Violations If Shellpoint questions whether California HBOR applies to HELOCs, California Civil Code 2924.12 ( d ) states protections apply to " any entity that seeks to foreclose on a mortgage or deed of trust '' on residential property. My HELOC is secured by my primary residence and therefore protected.

Shellpoint has violated : Accurate information requirements Good faith servicing obligations Dual tracking prohibitions 12. SHELLPOINT 'S PROPOSED " RESOLUTION '' IS INADEQUATE AND UNACCEPTABLE Shellpoint 's XX/XX/XXXX letter states they " waived legal and foreclosure-related fees totaling {$2500.00} '' with only a {$25.00} NSF fee remaining.

This is inadequate because : It does not correct the underlying accounting errors they admitted It does not explain where my {$39000.00} in payments were applied It does not credit my {$930.00} down payment overpayment It does not provide the accurate principal balance It does not rescind the wrongfully-filed Notice of Default It does not address their payment rejection pattern It does not resolve the 13-year draw period error 's impact Waiving fees they should never have charged in the first place does not resolve systematic accounting fraud and breach of contract.

13. SHELLPOINT 'S XX/XX/XXXX DENIAL LETTER PROVES THEY ARE NOT HONORING MY EXISTING MODIFICATION On XX/XX/XXXX, Shellpoint sent me a letter denying me for various loss mitigation programs, stating my housing debt-to-income ratio is out of the acceptable range.

This denial reveals the core problem : 1. I already have a valid, fully executed loan modification dated XX/XX/XXXX, with monthly payments of {$660.00} on a principal balance of {$110000.00}, acknowledged by the bankruptcy court.

2. I do not need new loss mitigation - I need Shellpoint to honor the existing modification agreement they inherited from XXXX. 
3. Shellpoint evaluated me as if I have no modification, determined I don't qualify for new programs, and is now proceeding with foreclosure.

4. This constitutes breach of contract. Shellpoint can not : - Refuse to honor a valid modification agreement - Require me to re-qualify for a modification I already have - Foreclose because I don't meet criteria for NEW loss mitigation Shellpoint 's position is clear : They do not recognize my XX/XX/XXXX modification as valid and binding. This is precisely why they have been misapplying my payments and rejecting my weekly payments that exceed the required $ XXXXmonth. 
I am not seeking new loss mitigation. I am demanding Shellpoint honor the existing modification agreement I have with my lender.

14. THE ISSUES REMAIN UNRESOLVED AND REQUIRE FURTHER INVESTIGATION At this time : My account history is still incorrect My XXXX modification has not been correctly applied My payments totaling {$39000.00} have not been properly credited My principal balance remains inconsistent and unexplained My arrears remain unverified and unexplained My rejected payments remain unexplained My draw period was misrepresented for thirteen years with no accounting correction Foreclosure proceedings continue despite unresolved servicing errors I am unable to make payments due to Shellpoint 's rejections CONCLUSION Shellpoint has admitted in writing to : Years of accounting errors ( XX/XX/XXXX - XX/XX/XXXX ) Misapplication of modification payments 13-year draw period configuration error ( XXXX, and even their " correction '' to XXXX is still wrong by 5 years ) Servicing errors requiring " corrections '' Despite these admissions, they have not corrected my account and continue to pursue foreclosure based on a delinquency THEY CREATED through their own errors.

I have paid {$39000.00} in good faith to perform under my modification agreement, making WEEKLY payments exceeding the required $ XXXX/month. I should not lose my home because Shellpoint failed to properly account for my payments.

Additionally, Shellpoint fabricated a loss mitigation application I never submitted, then rejected my payments while claiming to " evaluate '' me, then denied the fabricated application - all while refusing to honor my valid XX/XX/XXXX modification agreement.

The issues raised in my original complaint remain completely unresolved. Shellpoint 's response does not satisfy their obligations under RESPA and does not provide the accurate accounting I am legally entitled to receive.

I respectfully request CFPB 's continued oversight of this matter, as Shellpoint 's conduct has caused severe financial and emotional hardship for me and my family.

Thank you for your attention to this serious matter.

Complaint Against Shellpoint Mortgage Servicing I am submitting this complaint regarding serious issues I have experienced with Shellpoint Mortgage Servicing related to the handling of my mortgage loan. 

I am the authorized party for the loan listed below. 
Over the past several months, I have received inconsistent and conflicting information from Shellpoint regarding the status of this loan. I have made multiple attempts to understand my options and obtain accurate information, but the responses I received have been unclear and contradictory. 

On XX/XX/year>, I received a Notice of Default and Election to Sell by mail. This was the first formal written notice I received indicating foreclosure activity. However, before and after receiving this notice, Shellpoint representatives repeatedly told me that there was no active foreclosure, no foreclosure review in progress, and no sale-related action pending. These statements directly conflicted with the existence of the mailed Notice of Default and left me uncertain about the true status of the loan. 

In addition, there have been significant discrepancies in the reinstatement amounts I was provided. Shellpoints online portal shows that approximately {$16000.00} is past due. However, during phone calls, representatives quoted reinstatement amounts closer to {$20000.00}, without providing any written explanation or itemized breakdown. Despite requesting clarification, I have not received a written reinstatement quote or a clear explanation of the difference.

My attempts to resolve these issues have been frustrating. I have experienced disconnected calls, refusals to escalate my concerns to a supervisor, and a lack of written responses after verbal discussions and portal activity. I have not been provided with clear written determinations or consistent guidance, which has made it difficult to make informed decisions or move forward. 

I am asking for assistance to ensure this matter is handled properly. Specifically, I am requesting that Shellpoint be required to : Provide a clear, written, and itemized reinstatement amount Provide a full accounting of fees, charges, and payments applied to the loan Explain in writing the status and basis of the Notice of Default dated XX/XX/year>XXXX  Review the loan for servicing errors Pause foreclosure-related activity while these issues are reviewed Assign a single, knowledgeable point of contact I am seeking transparency, accurate information, and a fair opportunity to address the situation without further confusion or escalation caused by inconsistent servicing. 

Thank you for your assistance in reviewing this matter.

Consumer complaint narrative:
CFPB COMPLAINT ( UPDATED WITH XXXX / BOARD LIABILITY ) Subject : Servicer Misrepresentations to South Carolina Attorney General ; Contradictory Account Information ; Failure to Correct Notices of Error ; Systemic Misapplication of VA Loan Payments ; Corporate-Governance Violations Under XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 



Summary of the Issue My servicer ( NewRez/Shellpoint , owned and controlled by XXXX XXXX XXXX ) has issued false and contradictory account information to multiple regulators. Most recently, they supplied the South Carolina Attorney General with a letter that contradicts : their own recorded phone calls, multiple ledgers, screenshots of payment reversals, prior CFPB responses, documents submitted to XXXX, and VA loan servicing rules. 

This conduct violates : RESPA / Reg X 1024.35 failure to correct servicing errors RESPA / Reg X 1024.38 failure to maintain reasonable servicing policies Dodd-Frank UDAAP ( 12 U.S.C. 5531, 5536 ) VA Servicer Handbook M26-4 38 C.F.R. 36.4300 et seq. 

Further, because NewRez and XXXX are Delaware corporations, this pattern constitutes a XXXX oversight failure under : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 

This is a textbook case of failure to implement or monitor a system of controls, resulting in systemic misrepresentations to regulators and the borrower. 



Detailed Description 1. Contradictory Letter to SC Attorney General On receipt of a new letter sent by the servicer to the South Carolina AG, I identified blatant inconsistencies compared to : ledgers showing {$12000.00} unapplied ( recorded call on XX/XX/XXXX ), a ledger showing {$750.00} added then removed, previous statements claiming XXXX was paid, screenshots showing payments applied removed re-applied, earlier written assurances of error but without correction. 

The AG letter was not just inaccurateit contradicted evidence the AG already received from me.

Issuing false information to a regulator violates 12 C.F.R. 1024.38.

2. Repeated Failure to Correct a Notice of Error ( RESPA 1024.35 ) I sent multiple Notices of Error, including XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX, documenting : unapplied payments, mismatched balances, reversals without justification, improper suspense activity. 

Under Reg X 1024.35 ( e ) the servicer must correct or reasonably investigate.

They did neither.

Instead, they issued contradictory letters such as the one sent to SCAG. 



XXXX. Pattern of Misrepresentation Across Regulators The servicer has now issued different balances to : me ( borrower ) CFPB XXXX SC Attorney General These discrepancies are material, recurring, and inconsistent with federal requirements. 

This pattern of contradictory reporting meets the criteria for : UDAAP deception, RESPA systemic policy failure, and Delaware fiduciary-duty failure under XXXX. 



4. VA Loan Servicing Violations This is a VA-guaranteed loan, which imposes additional federal obligations : Accuracy of account information ( XXXX ) Proper application of payments Immediate correction of servicing errors Protection from improper default reporting None of these obligations were met. 



XXXX. Corporate Governance Violations ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) NewRez and XXXX are Delaware corporations, governed by a duty to implement and monitor systems preventing illegal activity. Delaware law clearly states : Directors/officers must ensure information-reporting systems exist ( XXXX ). 
Lack of oversight that allows repeated legal violations is a breach ( XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ). 
When a company operates in a mission-critical regulatory environment ( like mortgage servicing ), oversight failures are actionable ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ) XXXX 
Patterns of consumer-harm misconduct indicate failure to implement or monitor controls ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ). 

NewRezs and XXXX leadership, directors, risk officers, and legal officers are responsible for this systemic breakdown. 



XXXX. Specific Leadership with Oversight Responsibility NewRez XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) ultimate operational oversight XXXX XXXX ( Head of Servicing ) responsible for servicing accuracy XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) administrative controls XXXX XXXX ( Chief XXXX & XXXX XXXX ) legal compliance and risk XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) financial accuracy and ledgers XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) system controls and data integrity NewRez XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Parent Company ) XXXX XXXX ( CEO/Chairman ) ultimate fiduciary oversight XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) responsible for accounting controls XXXX XXXX ( Chief XXXX XXXX ) XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ) Each of these individuals is accountable under XXXX for ensuring : accurate reporting systems, lawful servicing practices, protection of borrowers under RESPA and federal law XXXX 

Their failure to prevent or correct systemic inconsistencies violates Delaware fiduciary-duty precedents. 



XXXX. Harm Suffered Because of these failures I have suffered : inability to determine lawful amount due threats of foreclosure based on false balances emotional/psychological distress financial uncertainty the impossibility of maintaining payment compliance inaccurate reporting across multiple regulators Requested CFPB Actions I request that the CFPB : XXXX. Require a full, corrected loan history from Day XXXX ( all suspense, escrow, reversals ). 
XXXX. Investigate the false statements made to the SC Attorney General. 
XXXX. Enforce corrective action for violations of Reg X 1024.35 and 1024.38. 
XXXX. Review UDAAP violations for deceptive reporting. 
XXXX. Examine whether NewRez/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX oversight duties given the systemic nature of these contradictions. 
XXXX. Freeze foreclosure activity until a fully accurate accounting is produced. 
XXXX. Open supervisory review into whether this reflects a systemic VA-loan servicing pattern. 
ADDITIONAL PARAGRAPH ( PLACE AFTER Harm Suffered ) I can not lawfully determine when my payment is due or how much I am supposed to pay, because the servicer has issued multiple conflicting balances, contradictory ledgers, inconsistent explanations, and reversals that do not match their own recorded calls or prior statements. These discrepancies directly interfere with my ability to comply with my VA-guaranteed mortgage obligations. Under RESPA/Reg X and VA servicing rules, a servicer must maintain accurate, consistent, and reliable account information. I can not continue throwing money into a system where payments disappear, are reclassified, removed, reapplied, or contradicted across regulators. Until I receive a fully accurate, corrected, and reconciled ledger, it is legally impossible for me to make proper payments, and the servicer can not threaten foreclosure based on information they themselves can not keep consistent. It is their duty, not mine, to maintain accurate records and respond truthfully.

Consumer complaint narrative:
CFPB Complaint Mortgage Servicer Wrongfully Withholding Insurance Proceeds Company : XXXX XXXX  XXXX  / NewRez XXXX XXXX  XXXX ( loss draft servicing ) Loan Number : XXXX Property : XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, MN XXXX Summary of the Issue : My mortgage servicer is repeatedly and unlawfully withholding my insurance loss draft funds after my home was destroyed by flooding. I can not rebuild or place the replacement home until these funds are released, and the servicer is adding unauthorized conditions each time I comply with their prior requests. 

What Happened : My home was declared a total loss due to flooding. 

Insurance issued a loss draft made payable to me and the mortgage company. 

I submitted all required claim documentation. 

I provided the location of the replacement home on higher ground as USDA requires. 

I provided access and approval for any necessary inspections. 

Despite meeting all requirements, the servicer refuses to release the funds and is engaging in the following unlawful behavior : XXXX. Adding moving target conditions not in my mortgage contract They have repeatedly created NEW, unauthorized requirements such as : Demanding that the old home be fully cleared and leveled before releasing insurance funds Demanding personal financial information ( bank statements, proof of cash reserves, income verification ) Demanding proof of how I will pay any difference in cost between old and new home Requiring site clearing before funds are disbursed, which is impossible since funds are needed to complete demolition and setup None of these demands exist in my mortgage, security instrument, USDA regulations, or loss draft agreements. 

XXXX. Violations of RESPA ( 12 CFR 1024.41 ) They are : Creating unreasonable delays Continuously adding new conditions Engaging in bad-faith servicing practices Withholding insurance funds without legal basis XXXX. Violations of USDA Servicer Requirements ( Handbook XXXX Chapter XXXX ) Under USDA loss draft rules, servicers may : Verify damage Confirm replacement/repair Inspect the property They may NOT : Demand personal financial disclosures Require demolition prior to funds release Withhold funds because the borrower declines to provide bank statements Invent new conditions after a file is complete 4. Financial Harm The servicers delay has prevented me from : Placing the replacement home Removing the destroyed structure Restoring the property for safe habitation Beginning construction Rebuilding after a federally recognized disaster XXXX. Requested Relief I request that CFPB require the servicer to : Immediately release the loss draft funds Cease adding unauthorized conditions Provide documentation of any legal or contractual authority for withholding funds Correct their servicing violations This situation is urgent and causing severe financial and emotional distress.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Date : XXXX  Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  I am writing to file a formal complaint against Shellpoint Mortgage Servicing regarding the mishandling of my mortgage modification request, the denial of my application, and the confusion surrounding foreclosure court proceedings. Additionally, I was not properly notified by letter of the denial until I proactively called to check on the status in XXXX, despite being informed that the denial occurred on XX/XX/XXXX. The online status also still shows my modification as " in review, '' which further complicates matters. 

Key Details : Application for Modification : I applied for mortgage assistance on XX/XX/XXXX, and I followed up with a call on XX/XX/XXXX to confirm that my application had been received. 

Document Submission : I submitted all requested documents promptly, but Shellpoint repeatedly asked for the same documents, which led to unnecessary delays in processing my request. 

Denial Notification : I was not notified of the denial of my modification by letter. It wasn't until I called to check on the status in XXXX that I was informed that my modification had been denied on XX/XX/XXXX due to the Net Present Value ( NPV ) test. Despite several requests, Shellpoint has not provided a detailed breakdown of the NPV calculation, including the input and output information used to determine the denial. 

Foreclosure Court : Although foreclosure proceedings were supposedly placed on hold during the modification review process, I was still required to attend foreclosure court. This was both stressful and confusing, as I had been led to believe that foreclosure actions would be suspended while my modification application was under review. 

Online Status Inconsistency : Despite being told that my modification was denied, the online portal still shows my status as " in review. '' This inconsistency has added to my frustration and confusion, leaving me unsure of whether the case is truly closed or if further action is required. 

Repeated Calls and Inadequate Assistance : On several occasions, I reached out to Shellpoint for updates, but each representative seemed either unaware of my case or unable to provide meaningful help. This lack of continuity and communication has prolonged the process and caused unnecessary stress. 


Given the lack of communication and the inconsistent information provided, I believe that Shellpoints handling of my case has been both inefficient and frustrating. I am requesting the following resolutions : 1. Clarification and Transparency : I request a full breakdown of the NPV calculation, including all input and output data used in the denial of my modification request. 


2. Proper Review of My Case : I ask that Shellpoint review my case comprehensively, ensuring all documentation is considered, and provide clear communication regarding the status of my application.

3. Address Foreclosure Court Proceedings : I request that Shellpoint explain why foreclosure court proceedings were initiated despite being informed that they would be on hold during the review process.

4. Resolve Online Status Discrepancy : I request that Shellpoint update the online portal to accurately reflect the current status of my modification request. 


5. Accountability for Poor Service : I ask that Shellpoint be held accountable for the delays, lack of transparency, and poor customer service throughout this process. 



I hope that the CFPB can assist in resolving this matter promptly and help ensure that Shellpoint provides a fair and transparent resolution to my situation. Thank you for your attention to this issue. I look forward to your response.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law

Consumer complaint narrative: My payment for my FHA loan keeps going up every year. Everytime I call and ask they say your insurance premium went up. I get cheaper insurance and it still goes up. Now it's my property value went up. Every year since I got the mortgage my payment has gone up. My recent issue is that I received a homestead exemption earlier this year that was backdated for XXXX years. I did not even know anything about a homestead exemption until last year. XXXX XXXX stated they completed my exemption and gave New Rez the information, this was back in XXXX or XXXX of this year. New Rez never applied my exemption which caused me to be overpaying about XXXX for XXXX  months until XXXX when I called to find out again why my tax bill was so high. They state they never got my homestead exemption documents, but the county and tax accessory office state they did give my updated information and they see the escrow account and they have been sending my tax bill and info to New Rez. So why all of a sudden they did not get my exemptions, but they have been getting my tax bill every year. My escrow account is sitting over XXXX  plus right now and I don't have an insurance payment until XXXX of next year. That will put my escrow account well over XXXX but they are still saying I have a XXXX shortage. New Rez is over charging for my escrow payments. Over XXXX of my payment goes into escrow but I'm still short. I have requested to be refunded my overpayment due to them not doing my analysis at the beginning of the year and waiting until XXXX. They say the overpayment went into my escrow to cover my shortage. I asked why then is it showing on my account I'm expecting to have a shortage of XXXX. XXXX if my overage payment covered my shortage. They say it's going by the analysis from the beginning of the year. I asked how when they just did an analysis in XXXX of this year. They can't explain it to me they say we'll just look at your payment history everything is based off the analysis at the beginning of the year. I ask why again because they just did an analysis. The call ended with the supervisor saying well you have to have a cushion so that's why you have a shortage. My escrow account is sitting at over XXXX  how am I short. They are gouging people and taking their hard earned money. It seems as if they are purposely raising the payment every year so people can't afford to pay and loose their home. It's not right. New Rez LLC is overcharging on FHA loans and for escrow accounts and it needs to be investigated.

Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern, I am submitting this complaint regarding a late payment reported on my mortgage account that I believe was unfair and caused significant, unexpected damage to my credit. 

Due to a temporary financial hardship, I proactively contacted my mortgage servicer in XX/XX/2025 to set up a payment plan to catch up on two missed months. This plan was set up verbally over the phone, and no written agreement or disclosure was provided to me regarding the timing or potential impact on my credit. 

At no point was I informed that the scheduled payment date under this plan would still fall past the reporting threshold and be reported as late to the credit bureaus. Had I been made aware, I would have paid 1-4 days earlier to prevent any negative impact. 

Despite following the plan as instructed, I received a notification on XX/XX/2025, that my credit score dropped almost 40 points due to this reported late payment. I have been contacting the servicer and speaking with customer service agents for six months, trying to resolve this issue. Only in XX/XX/2025 was I finally told that they can not accept credit disputes online and that I must submit them via mail, even though I have been calling every week or couple weeks since XXXX and none of the representatives ever told me that. 

When I disputed this directly with the servicer, they stated the payment was reported accurately and refused to take corrective action, without addressing the lack of disclosure or explanation regarding the credit impact. 

I am requesting : A review of the call records or servicing notes from the payment plan setup Consideration of a goodwill adjustment to remove the reported late payment Improved disclosure practices for borrowers entering payment plans Recognition of the prolonged difficulty and poor communication I experienced over the past six months Thank you for your attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative:
Issue : Conflicting Corporate Addresses & Identities NewRez / Shellpoint / Rithm I am a XXXX veteran with a XXXX-backed mortgage serviced under the NewRez / Shellpoint / Rithm platform. Even at the most basic level Where is my servicer actually located and who is responsible? I can not get a consistent answer. 

A. Evidence of conflicting addresses and identities XXXX. Shellpoint envelope addressed to me I received physical mail from Shellpoint showing : Shellpoint, XXXX. XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, FL XXXX Addressed to : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, TN XXXX XXXX. BBB XXXX for NewRez LLC The Better Business Bureau entry for NewRez LLC shows : Local office : XXXX XXXX XXXX # XXXX, XXXX, NC XXXX Additional info for headquarters : XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, PA XXXX. 
XXXX. Public corporate information / search results for NewRez Public corporate information describes NewRez as having : Headquarters at XXXX Office XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX Washington, PA, Corporate location at XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, PA, and Correspondence / error-resolution address as P.O. Box XXXX, XXXX, SC XXXX. 
The same information identifies XXXX XXXX as the parent company of NewRez. 
XXXX. Shellpoint vs. NewRez branding My loan has been handled under both Shellpoint and NewRez branding, with different addresses attached to each name, while XXXX own public disclosures describe NewRez as a subsidiary and integrate servicer revenues into XXXX business. 

As a borrower, I am facing : Multiple different headquarters across XXXX Washington, PA ; XXXX XXXX, PA ; XXXX, NC ; Different correspondence or error resolution P.O. Boxes in XXXX, SC and XXXX XXXX, FL ; and XXXX different operating names ( NewRez and Shellpoint ), plus a parent ( XXXX XXXX ) that profits from this platform while disowning it in CFPB responses. 

This is not a minor clerical inconsistency. The system is designed so I can never be sure which address, which name, or which entity is legally responsible for fixing my account. 



How this violates federal law and compromises the system I believe this conduct violates, at a minimum : XXXX. RESPA & XXXX XXXX ( XXXX U.S.C. XXXX ; XXXX C.F.R. XXXX, XXXX, XXXX ) Servicers must clearly designate where borrowers send Notices of Error ( NOEs ) and Requests for XXXX ( RFIs ) and must have policies and procedures reasonably designed to ensure proper handling. 
Maintaining multiple, conflicting error resolution, correspondence, and headquarters addresses under different brand names ( NewRez, Shellpoint ) makes it unreasonably difficult for me to know where to send NOEs/RFIs and gives the servicer an excuse to claim it did not receive them or that they were sent to the wrong location. 
This defeats the core purpose of XXXX XXXX, which is to give borrowers a clear, working channel to dispute errors and demand corrections before delinquency and foreclosure occur. 
XXXX. XXXX XXXX provisions ( Dodd-Frank Act XXXX, XXXX ; XXXX U.S.C. XXXX, XXXX ) Presenting different addresses and corporate identities to different audiences is deceptive and abusive : To borrowers, I see a confusing shell-game of NewRez vs. Shellpoint vs. P.O. Boxes in several states. 
To investors and the SEC, XXXX presents NewRez/Shellpoint as an integrated, centrally-controlled platform generating consolidated revenue. 
This discrepancy is a classic UDAAP : it materially interferes with my ability to understand who my servicer is, where to send legal notices, and how to exercise my rights, while the parent and investors continue to enjoy the cash flows. 
XXXX. FDCPA ( XXXX XXXX. XXXX et seq. ), to the extent Shellpoint/NewRez act as debt XXXX If Shellpoint / NewRez qualify as debt XXXX, they must not use false, deceptive, or misleading representations, including the false representation of the character or legal status of any debt or use of any business, company, or organization name other than the true name of the debt XXXX business. 
XXXX between NewRez and Shellpoint names and addresses, while failing to clearly identify the true entity responsible for servicing and error resolution, risks violating FDCPA sections on misrepresentations and unfair practices. 
XXXX. State unfair and deceptive acts and practices ( UDAP ) statutes & mortgage-servicing laws Every state, including Tennessee, South Carolina XXXX North Carolina XXXX Pennsylvania, and Florida, has UDAP statutes that prohibit confusing, deceptive, or unfair servicing practices. 
Using multiple conflicting addresses and corporate personas to handle XXXX XXXX mortgage is unfair and deceptive because it obstructs my ability, and the ability of any reasonable consumer, to assert rights, cure errors, or prevent wrongful foreclosure. 
XXXX. SEC / securities-law integrity ( connection to XXXX ) Public information and Rithms own XXXX identify NewRez as a subsidiary of XXXX XXXX and XXXX the mortgage-servicing platform as part of Rithms consolidated business that XXXX equity, preferred shares, and XXXX compensation. 
This makes the address and identity chaos not just a consumer-protection problem but a system-level control problem : XXXX tells investors it XXXX and controls NewRez/Shellpoint and relies on XXXX XXXX XXXX flows. 
At the same time, the platform uses a maze of addresses and brands that prevent borrowers from effectively reaching the true responsible entity, undermining the integrity of the servicing operations that back the securities. 



Systemic impact & risk This is not just my confusion. If I, as a XXXX veteran with a XXXX loan, can not determine : which legal entity services my loan, which address will actually process a Notice of XXXX, and which company is accountable for corrupted ledgers and foreclosure threats, then every other borrower in this platform faces the same structural trap. 

The multiple headquarters and correspondence addresses show : A servicing system spread across several states and brands, A parent company ( Rithm ) that profits from the system but has allowed this fragmented address structure to persist, and A built-in defense : any time a borrower sends a compliant notice, the company can argue it was mailed to the wrong address or entity. 

This undermines : The entire XXXX XXXX XXXX for error resolution, State UDAP enforcement, and The reliability of the servicing platform that XXXX uses to support registered securities and insider compensation. 



Requested CFPB action ( address-focused ) XXXX. Require NewRez / Shellpoint / Rithm to : Designate and publicly disclose XXXX clear, uniform address for RESPA Notices of Error and Requests for Information for my loan, Confirm in writing which legal entity is responsible for servicing my loan and for correcting ledger errors, and Align all correspondence, billing, and collection letters to that single servicing identity and address. 
XXXX. Investigate whether the use of multiple addresses and trade names constitutes : A XXXX X violation ( failure to maintain reasonable policies and procedures for error resolution ), A UDAAP under the Consumer Financial Protection Act, and A violation of any applicable state UDAP or mortgage-servicing laws. 
XXXX. Coordinate, as appropriate, with : State regulators in TN, SC, NC, PA, FL, and any other states implicated by these addresses, and The SEC, regarding whether Rithms public representations about owning and controlling its servicing platforms are consistent with the fragmented and confusing address structure presented to borrowers.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative:
COMPLAINT TO THE CONSUMER FINANCIAL PROTECTION BUREAU - CONTINUATION OF CFPB CASE NO. XXXX Borrower : XXXX XXXX Lender/Servicer : NewRez LLC Mortgage account XXXX XXXX XXXX Property Address : XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Subject : Violation of RESPA 6 / 12 CFR 1024.35 ( Error Resolution ) and TILA 129G / 12 CFR 1026.36 ( c ) ( Prompt Payment Crediting ) due to Servicer 's Rescission of a Prior Written Resolution and Failure to Implement Agreed-Upon Bi-Weekly Payment Crediting.

1. Introduction & Pattern of Conduct I am filing this follow-up complaint regarding NewRez 's failure to resolve a servicing error and its subsequent rescission of a written resolution, which constitutes a new and separate violation.

A pattern is evident in NewRez 's servicing. When I correspond directly, responses are delayed with repeated requests for " more time '' ( e.g., Letters dated XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, and XX/XX/year> ). However, upon the filing of my initial CFPB complaint on XX/XX/year>, NewRez produced a detailed response by XX/XX/year>. This demonstrates that prompt resolution is possible, yet is only undertaken under regulatory oversight. 

2. Summary of the Issue On XX/XX/year>, NewRez provided a written resolution ( Exhibit 13 ) to my Notice of Error, agreeing to : 1. Retroactively apply my bi-weekly payments effective the date funds were received.

2. Mail me a custom bi-weekly amortization schedule within 10 business days. 

NewRez never fulfilled the amortization schedule promise. 

In its XX/XX/year>, response to CFPB ( Exhibit 16 ), NewRez unilaterally rescinded the agreement, citing " system limitations '' and apologizing for " misinformation. '' With the response I received on XX/XX/year>, NewRez showed two flaws : 1. A servicer can not resolve an error in writing and then, weeks later, simply declare that resolution " erroneous '' without violating RESPA 's error-resolution procedures. 

3. Chronology of Facts & Legal Violations : XXXX. XX/XX/year> ( Exhibit 06 ) : I submitted a written request for a true bi-weekly payment plan, where each half-payment is credited upon receipt as required by TILA ( 12 CFR 1026.36 ( c ) ( 1 ) ( i ) ).

3.2. XX/XX/year> ( Exhibit 08 ) : After NewRez 's initial non responsive reply, I sent a follow-up that constituted a formal Notice of Error ( NOE ) under RESPA ( 12 CFR 1024.35 ), specifically citing : 3.2.1 Failure to apply an accepted payment as agreed.

3.2.2 Failure to credit a payment as of the date of receipt. 

3.3. XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX ( Exhibit 10, 11, 12 ) : NewRez sent me several letters delaying my requesting, " more time '' to respond. 

3.4. XX/XX/year> ( Exhibit 13 ) : NewRez acknowledged the error and provided a written resolution, agreeing to my requested crediting method and promising a custom amortization schedule. This letter created a binding commitment. 

3.5. XX/XX/year> ( Exhibit 14 ) : Due to NewRez 's delay in providing the promised amortization schedule, I sent a written reminder, indicating that I will send my complaint to the CFPB. 

3.6. XX/XX/year> ( Exhibit 15 ) : NewRez continued sending me delay letter. 

3.7. XX/XX/year> ( Exhibit 16 ) : NewRez responded through CFPB breached its agreement, stating it could not honor the XX/XX/XXXX resolution and reaffirming its non compliant practice of holding partial payments in suspense. 

4. Legal Analysis : NewRez Violated RESPA 's Error-Resolution Procedures ( 12 CFR 1024.35 ) 4.1. A servicer must respond to an NOE within a specified timeframe. NewRez 's serial " more time '' letters, followed by a definitive resolution ( Exhibit 13 ) and subsequent retraction ( Exhibit 16 ), demonstrates a failure to conduct a reasonable investigation and provide a final, accurate response. A resolved error can not be " un-resolved '' without triggering a new violation.

4.2. NewRez Violated TILA 's Prompt Crediting Rule ( 12 CFR 1026.36 ( c ) ) : The law is clear : " A servicer shall credit a periodic payment to the consumer 's loan account as of the date of receipt. '' NewRez 's policy of holding the first half payment in a suspense account ( as admitted in its ACH form, Exhibit 18 ) is a direct violation. 
" System limitations '' are not a legal defense. Servicers are required to maintain systems that comply with federal law. NewRez 's inability to generate a bi-weekly amortization schedule is an admission that its system is not configured to comply with the prompt crediting rule, which is itself a non compliance with the regulations.

4.3. The Amortization Schedule is Essential for Verification and Transparency The promised amortization schedule is not a mere courtesy ; it is the controlling math that operationalizes the agreed crediting method and enables audit against statements and payoff quotes ( which must be provided within 7 business days upon written request ). ( 15 U.S.C. 1639g. ) It is the necessary tool to verify that NewRez is complying with the law and its own agreement.Without it, I can not confirm that NewRez is applying as of receipt ( or properly retro applying component halves to their receipt dates once the monthly threshold is met ). The missing schedule is the core gap that forces ongoing disputes.
Company public response: Company believes complaint represents an opportunity for improvement to better serve consumers

Consumer complaint narrative:
Loan Number : XXXX Property Address : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, CA XXXX Borrowers ' Current Legal Names : XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX Incorrect Names on Account : XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX I am filing a formal complaint against our mortgage servicer, Shellpoint, for their persistent and unlawful failure to maintain accurate account information, which has resulted in a complete refusal to communicate with me and my wife, the legal account holders. 

1. The Core Error : Our legal names were changed from XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX to XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX by a court order ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) in XXXX This change was finalized years before this mortgage was originated. We have provided Shellpoint with a copy of the official court decree and our U.S. Passports, which all confirm our legal names are XXXX. Despite this irrefutable evidence, Shellpoint 's systems only recognize our former, invalid names. 

XXXX. The Impact and Violation : This is not a minor error. Shellpoint 's failure to update our records has severe consequences : Refusal to Communicate : When I, XXXX XXXX, call and identify myself by my legal name, Shellpoint representatives refuse to speak to me or provide any information about our loan ( number XXXX ). They will only engage if I falsely use my former name, XXXX. This is a direct refusal to provide service to the account holders. 

Blocked Access : We are systematically denied access to information about our own loan and can not conduct necessary business unless we misrepresent our identities. This is a fundamental violation of our rights as consumers. 

XXXX. The Expanded Risk : This error is not contained within Shellpoint. We are aware that other entities are involved, including XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, and XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX. Because Shellpoint has not corrected its internal records, it is certain that these inaccurate details ( our former names ) are being communicated to these other parties. This creates a significant risk of improper communications, faulty legal documents, and a fundamental breach of our privacy throughout the entire loan ecosystem. 

XXXX. Desired Resolution : We demand that Shellpoint immediately : Update its primary records to reflect our legal names, XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX. 

Provide written confirmation that this change has been completed. 

Identify and coordinate with all other entities involved in the servicing, ownership, or legal proceedings of this loanspecifically XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, and XXXX XXXX XXXXto ensure they immediately receive corrected, accurate information about the borrowers ' legal identities. 

Ensure all future communications from Shellpoint and its partners are addressed to our correct legal names. 

Train its staff to handle legal name changes appropriately and to never refuse service to an account holder who provides their correct legal name. 

This is a serious failure to maintain accurate records as required by consumer financial protection laws. Shellpoint 's continued inaction, despite multiple notifications, is unacceptable and has left us with no other recourse. 

We have attached the official court decree and U.S. Passports as definitive proof. We expect Shellpoint to resolve this completely, which includes fixing the information with all other involved parties.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
