Consumer complaint narrative: In XXXX of XXXX, I was informed that my mortgage service for an investment property had been transferred to NewRez LLC, who does business as Shellpoint Mortgage Servicing. On multiple occasions, I attempted to establish an online account, to no avail, with their system informing me that my information did not exist in their datbases. After multiple discussions with customer service reps across multiple days, I was informed that the social security number listed in their system did not match the documentation received from the original servicer, and that the only resolution was for me to send a copy of a XXXX to Shellpoint. I refused, as I had confirmed with my mortgage broker that a correct XXXX had been included in the original loan application. After XXXX near identical calls, I was able to speak with a customer service manager who informed me that the issue had arisen due to a data entry error by Shellpoint, which he was able to repair. Several months passed, and I was able to make my payments online. I logged into the Shellpoint website on XX/XX/XXXX to pay my bill, and to my surprise, the system informed me that I was unable to use their online system due to the loan being in " active bankruptcy ''. This status report was confirmed by a customer service rep, XXXX XXXX, who reported speaking with an agent in their " Commercial Department '', who entered the status on XXXX in response to a letter from a law firm representing " XXXX XXXX XXXX '' in a XXXX  XXXX bankruptcy filing. The issue is that I have no knowledge or dealings with " XXXX XXXX XXXX '', and I have never received any correspondence from any party regarding this alleged bankruptcy. It would appear that once again, I am being subjected to an adverse administrative action due to inaccurate data entry by a Shellpoint employee. This is a pattern of behavior that is unacceptable for a national entity in the financial services industry.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law

Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue while managing or servicing your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
Supplemental to complaint number XXXX Subject : Misapplication of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Inflated Escrow Payments, and Failure to Correct Billing Errors This Notice of Error is submitted pursuant to 12 C.F.R. 1024.35 to identify and request correction of multiple servicing errors originating with XXXX XXXX and continued by Shellpoint Mortgage Servicing. These errors concern the handling of state assistance funds from the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  ), misapplied escrow accounting, and Shellpoints failure to correct an overbilled payment amount after I repeatedly asked them to review my account. 

This complaint supplements prior communications and relates to CFPB Complaint # XXXX. 

Factual Background XXXX XXXX XXXX ( During XXXX XXXX ) : The XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX approved funds to bring my loan current, covering both delinquent mortgage payments and past-due property taxes. XXXX XXXX failed to request the tax portion of the approved funds. Consequently, XXXX sent only the mortgage-payment portion. XXXX applied those funds solely toward mortgage principal and interest, leaving property taxes unpaid. XXXX then advanced its own funds to pay those past-due property taxes taxes that should have been covered by XXXX and created a false escrow shortage. This caused my monthly payment to increase from approximately {$2800.00} to {$3000.00}, even though the underlying property-tax obligation itself had not increased. The shortage resulted solely from XXXX mismanagement and failure to request the appropriate assistance funds. 

Second XXXX XXXX ( Also During XXXX XXXX  ) : A later round of XXXX funds included both mortgage and tax components. This assistance brought my account fully current and paid all past-due property taxes in full. The relief briefly decreased my mortgage payment ; however, XXXX XXXX never reconciled or corrected the false shortage created during the first assistance round. As a result, the account continued to reflect an inflated escrow balance, even though all property taxes had been paid after the second round of assistance. A scheduled adjustable-rate increase later raised the payment slightly, but the underlying overcollection from the earlier shortage remained embedded in the account. 

Transfer to Shellpoint ( XX/XX/year> ) : When Shellpoint took over servicing, it imported XXXX XXXX inflated escrow balance and continued billing me {$3000.00} per month. I made multiple verbal requests by phone asking Shellpoint to perform its own escrow analysis, as I believed the payment amount was incorrect. Shellpoint representatives repeatedly said they were not required to conduct a new analysis until their next scheduled cycle. Despite my repeated requests, Shellpoint refused to perform an updated analysis until XX/XX/year>. This demonstrates a lack of reasonable diligence, contrary to 12 C.F.R. 1024.35 ( a ) and ( e ) ( 1 ) ( i ).

Shellpoints Escrow Analysis ( XX/XX/year> ) : Shellpoints analysis dated XX/XX/year>, determined that my correct monthly payment should have been {$2800.00}, effective XX/XX/year>. This reflects my true contractual obligation for principal, interest, and property taxes. My account does not include insurance escrow. The same analysis revealed a separate {$3600.00} surplus in my escrow account, confirming that it had been overfunded for months prior. While Shellpoint may not have initially known of XXXX error, its own analysis confirmed the correct payment amount. At that point, Shellpoint had knowledge of the miscalculation but failed to retroactively correct prior billing discrepancies or refund the surplus, in violation of 12 C.F.R. 1024.17 ( f ) ( 2 ).

Errors Requiring Correction Failure to properly apply state-provided assistance funds, in violation of 12 C.F.R. 1024.35 ( b ) ( XXXX ). 

Failure to reconcile the escrow account after the second XXXX assistance when all past-due property taxes had been fully paid. 

Failure to refund or credit surplus escrow funds, in violation of XXXX ( f ) ( XXXX ). 

Continuation of a fabricated escrow shortage, resulting in inflated monthly payments. 

Failure to act with reasonable diligence in response to multiple borrower requests. 

Failure to adjust the billed payment from {$3000.00} to {$2800.00} after confirming the corrected amount. 

Requested Resolution Please : Audit my account from the first XXXX assistance forward. 

Remove all false escrow shortages created from misapplied funds. 

Retroactively correct my payment to {$2800.00} from the earliest date the miscalculation began, which predates Shellpoints onboarding. While Shellpoint may not have initially known of the miscalculation, its XX/XX/year> escrow analysis confirmed the true payment amount. From that point forward, Shellpoint had knowledge of the error but failed to correct prior overbilling. Refund or credit the difference between {$3000.00} and {$2800.00} for all affected months. 

Apply credits for overbilling before and after XX/XX/year>. 

Apply or refund the {$3600.00} escrow surplus. 

Provide a full itemized accounting of all XXXX funds and escrow disbursements. 

Confirm corrected balances in writing within XXXX business days, per RESPA. 

As stated in my prior complaint, I continue to dispute all foreclosure-related attorney fees and legal charges assessed during periods when assistance review or account correction was pending. These charges must be audited, fully explained, and, if found improper, reversed and credited to my account. 

Respectfully, XXXX XXXX XXXX
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue related to modification, forbearance, short sale, deed-in-lieu, bankruptcy, or foreclosure
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have reviewed Shellpoints XX/XX/XXXX response to my previous complaint filed and I disagree that there was no error. Shellpoints own letter admits that an incorrect Social Security Number was transferred to Specialized Loan Servicing ( SLS ) during the loan transfer process and that it was not corrected until XX/XX/XXXX. During that period, when I used their find my account tool with my SSN and ZIP code, the system pulled up another borrowers loan ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  ) and displayed his full names, property address, loan number ending in XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, mortgagee clause, and active XXXX homeowners policy, while searches under my correct name and date of birth showed no accounts found. My own loan was simultaneously linked to a different SSN. This is more than a minor transfer error ; it is a serious datasecurity and privacy breach that exposed both my identity and another familys complete mortgage and insurance profile, in violation of federal privacy and safeguard rules. Issuing a gift card for XXXX does not cure that harm, and Shellpoint has not provided any technical explanation or logs showing how my SSN was mismapped or what they have done to prevent this from happening again. 
In addition, Shellpoints description of the trial modification leaves out critical context. Their letter confirms that I was approved on XX/XX/XXXX for a threepayment trial plan at {$550.00}, and that payments were received on XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX XX/XX/XXXX, and XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX. Their own system showed the trial as Approved and a Shellpoint representative told me on XX/XX/XXXX that all required trial payments had been made and final modification documents would be mailed. Only after that assurance did they claim that some payments were later returned XXXX. I was never given timely written notice that any trial payment had failed, nor a clear cure period to replace it, nor an explanation of why a fourth payment of {$560.00} made on XX/XX/XXXX ( after the three required trial payments ) did not satisfy the plan. Instead, they rescinded the trial on XX/XX/XXXX and later blamed investor guidelines and delinquency, even though I continued trying to make payments and could not reach my Single Point of Contact for weeks. Shellpoints own app now shows a red banner stating this loan has a legal status preventing online payments while they continue to charge late fees, making it impossible for me to pay online but still treating nonpayment as my fault. 

I am filing this complaint against NewRez LLC XXXX Shellpoint Mortgage Servicing for a pattern of abusive and unlawful mortgageservicing practices on my homeequity loan. Shellpoint incorrectly boarded my loan with the wrong Social Security number and, for months, their online find my account tools pulled up another borrowers full mortgage and insurance information under my SSN while my own account was not findable under my correct identity. This exposed both households private financial data and created serious identitytheft and creditreporting risks. Shellpoint has admitted in writing that an incorrect SSN was transferred and corrected later, but has never explained how long the crosslink existed, how many times it was accessed, or what safeguards were implemented to prevent this from recurring. 
At the same time, Shellpoint has mishandled my payments and lossmitigation requests. They approved me for a trial modification, accepted multiple trial payments, and verbally confirmed that all required payments were received and that a permanent modification would be processed. After I relied on those assurances, they abruptly rescinded the trial plan, claimed payments were returned or the investor declined, and treated my loan as delinquent without giving me a clear cure period or a meaningful way to resolve the issue. Shellpoint has also blocked me from making online payments by flagging my loan as having a legal status preventing online payments, while still adding late fees and other defaultrelated charges. In addition, they have added inspection/BPO and other fees that appear excessive and unsupported by any change in property condition or occupancy. 

Shellpoint claimed previously that my social security was incorrect due to the previous serving company sending it at the time of transfer which Figure had sent documents stating my social being correct with their accounts and my name and said that they in fact did not send the incorrect social number with my account at transfer. Shellpoint is responsible for the mishandling of my account and personal information.

Because of these actions, my credit has been damaged, my account balance inflated by questionable fees and capitalized deferred amounts, and I have been left in constant fear of foreclosure despite actively trying to resolve the situation and make payments.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law

Violations : - RESPA / Regulation X ( 12 C.F.R. 1024.17 escrow management ; 1024.34 timely disbursements ; 1024.35 error resolution ) - CFPA unfair/deceptive practices

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am submitting this complaint to dispute improper legal fees assessed by my mortgage servicer, Shellpoint Mortgage Servicing, on Loan # XXXX. 

Shellpoint assessed legal fees on my account while my loan was current and without substantiated legal necessity. These charges were applied after all prior legal fees had been paid in full and without documentation of authorized or active legal action. 

My XX/XX/XXXX mortgage statement confirms that prior legal fees totaling {$9200.00} were paid in full and that no additional legal or escrow balances remained outstanding beyond my regular monthly payment. Despite this documented zero balance, Shellpoint later assessed additional legal fees in XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX. 

In response to my dispute, Shellpoint provided documentation postmarked XX/XX/XXXX. This documentation showing a later date than the XX/XX/XXXX zero-balance statement and predates the later legal fee assessments. Documentation predating a paid-in-full status can not justify subsequent legal charges. 

Shellpoint has also alleged a prior unpaid balance of {$1200.00}, which directly contradicts the XX/XX/XXXX statement showing a XXXX balance. No transaction-level reconciliation or supporting documentation has been provided to substantiate this amount. 

Shellpoint has failed to provide : A foreclosure index or court docket number Copies of any summons, complaint, motion, or court filing Evidence that foreclosure proceedings were active, pending, or required while the loan was current Under RESPA ( 12 CFR 1024 ), applicable XXXX XXXX law, and the mortgage agreement, fees assessed to a borrower must be necessary, reasonable, actually incurred, and contractually permitted. Fees assessed while the loan is current and unsupported by contemporaneous legal action do not meet this standard.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Summary : Newrez ( mortgage owner ) and Shellpoint Mortgage Services LLC ( servicer ) collecting and mishandling tax escrow ; escrow analysis error ( s ) ; failure to functionally or procedurally apply property tax exemption, failure to address formal Notice of Error ( NOE ). 

Imminent Financial Harm : I have remained current for all payments on my mortgage to the present date. My next automated mortgage payment, scheduled for XX/XX/XXXX, continues to be scheduled at an incorrect, inflated amount of {$2600.00} which improperly includes {$140.00} tax escrow I do not owe. 

Justification for Complaint : Servicer is collecting and holding tax escrow not owed. Servicer recognizes borrower 's ( author ) permanent {$0.00} property tax obligation and confirmed permanent {$0.00} property tax obligation with the tax authority. Despite this, servicer claims escrow shortage citing tax refund processing / timing ( surplus funds ) and anticipated future taxes ( error ). Servicer verbally stated borrower must continue to pay tax escrow not owed included with Principal, Interest and Insurance, otherwise partial payment, possible default and / or other negative consequences will be levied. Servicer verbally stated this event would be " beyond their control '' because " their system '' does it automatically. Servicer has demonstrated apathy toward the issue and has not substantially responded to my formal NOE, under the Real Estate Settlement Procedures Act ( RESPA ), Regulation X, in a way outside of " general inquiry ''. Responses received to date generally reiterate previously provided information and include the tax escrow error I am disputing. I do not have confidence the servicer will address or correct these issues without formal oversight. 

Key Events -- XX/XX/XXXX : Shellpoint Mortgage Services LLC, correctly paid the second half of my XXXX property tax. 

XX/XX/XXXX : I provided official documentation demonstrating permanent Virginia XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. After follow-up calls to customer service, Newrez / Shellpoint XXXX XXXX document and confirmed {$0.00} obligation with the tax authority XXXX XXXX tax line on the mortgage to reflect {$0.00}. 

XX/XX/XXXX : Newrez / Shellpoint confirms taxes paid on XX/XX/XXXX and states the tax authority has confirmed the funds were disbursed by XXXX, the tax vendor. Newrez / Shellpoint confirms excess amount of {$2200.00} will be refunded. 

XX/XX/XXXX : Newrez / Shellpoint automatically drafts the full, previously scheduled mortgage payment including all property taxes, in the amount of {$2800.00}. 

XX/XX/XXXX : Mailed Formal Notice of Error ( NOE ) notifying Owner / Servicer of tax escrow collection error. NOE provides personal identifying information, loan number, requests correction, describes error ( s ) and legal basis, as well as actions required. Borrower provided two written notices, for posterity, via online website portals, indicating mailed NOEs to both organizations. 

XX/XX/XXXX : Newrez XXXX Shellpoint conducts escrow analysis and adjusts mortgage payment to {$2600.00}. The adjusted figure includes City tax escrow. 

XX/XX/XXXX : Newrez/ Shellpoint correspondence confirms review of account to ensure " escrow accurately reflects a {$0.00} tax obligation ''. Newrez XXXX Shellpoint confirms adjusted tax refund of {$1500.00}, with prorated {$710.00} tax for second half of XXXX. In the same correspondence, Newrez XXXX Shellpoint notes previous mortgage payment of {$2800.00} has been reduced to {$2600.00}, effective XX/XX/XXXX, which still includes anticipated property tax for XXXX. Newrez XXXX Shellpoint further notes monthly payment consists of {$310.00} for escrow, and that in XX/XX/XXXX Newrez / Shellpoint anticipates City tax. Moreover, Newrez XXXX Shellpoint notes the anticipated escrow balance will be - {$480.00} due to anticipated City tax payment. 

XX/XX/XXXX : The City Treasurer 's office issued refund check to Corelogic ( tax vendor ) in the amount of {$1500.00}, check # XXXX. 

XX/XX/XXXX : XXXX tracking, # XXXX, confirms Shellpoint received NOE on XX/XX/XXXX. 

XX/XX/XXXX : In a recorded call to customer service following-up with the NOE, a Newrez / Shellpoint representative named " XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX regard to my NOE that " nothing has been done and there is nothing to do because the escrow analysis is already complete. '' I explained the NOE I sent was a result of error in the escrow analysis she referenced and asked her to note the dates they'd received the NOE in my loan file because the servicer is supposed to correct the errors within XXXX working days. 

XX/XX/XXXX : I received written correspondence from Newrez / Shellpoint, indicating they are responding to my " inquiry ''. The response reiterates all previously provided information from XX/XX/XXXX and previous dates. Newrez / Shellpoint recognize my {$0.00} tax obligation, and states after a review of the account they have not identified an error in the escrow analysis. In the same correspondence, Newrez XXXX Shellpoint also reaffirm next scheduled payment of {$2600.00}, which includes payment for tax escrow ( error ). 

XX/XX/XXXX : I called Newrez / Shellpoint customer service to request whether or not my NOE was being treated as an NOE or a 'general inquiry ''. I did not receive an answer to this question. I also asked for the investigation / case file number in regard to the NOE investigation under way. In response to this question, the customer service representative, " XXXX XXXX XXXX, provided a " Task Number '', # XXXX, and elaborated no one at Newrez XXXX Shellpoint will understand what that number is if I call again and provide the task number. He stated, " it is just a number associated to the task in the computer system. '' XXXX informed me Newrez XXXX Shellpoint has not yet received my tax refund from the City Tax authority, but when they do they will conduct a new escrow analysis. He elaborated to the effect of " the way escrow works is that the account will show an escrow shortage until the refund is processed. '' When asked to clarify, in that event, why I am still paying for taxes I do not owe, and Newrez / Shellpoint knows I do not owe, and the tax authority has confirmed I do not owe, XXXX reiterated " that is how the system works. '' XX/XX/XXXX : I sent a written message to Newrez / Shellpoint via online portal, stating the written response ( s ) I received appear to be response ( s ) to a 'general inquiry ' and do not address error ( s ) identified in the NOE. I requested Newrez / Shellpoint to treat the NOE as correspondence under RESPA, Regulation X, and stated treatment of my correspondence as general inquiry is incorrect.

Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue while managing or servicing your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
I applied for a VA loan modification with my mortgage company. During the process, I was explicitly informed that no payments were due while the modification was under review. Despite this, the company reported my mortgage as late to the credit bureaus. I was never provided written notice that my account would be reported as delinquent during the modification process. This inaccurate reporting has harmed my credit history and score. 

I believe this reflects improper servicing practices and a failure to provide required notice before furnishing negative information to the credit bureaus. I relied on the companys instructions, and the reporting of missed payments is misleading and unfair.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute the accuracy of the information you are furnishing to the credit reporting agencies regarding the account listed under XXXX SHELLPOINT MORTGAGE, Account No. XXXX. This information is appearing inaccurately on my credit reports, and I am exercising my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2, to demand a full investigation and correction of the errors you are reporting.

The account in question is reflecting a XXXXXXXX late payment for XX/XX/year> and a XXXX late payment for XX/XX/year>, which are inaccurate. Additionally, this account was previously deleted from my credit reports, yet it has been reinserted without providing the legally required notice, which is a violation of FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 5 ) ( B ) when a furnisher participates in or transmits reinsertion data without proper verification. As the furnisher of this data, you are required to ensure that the information reported to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX is accurate, complete, and verifiable.

Under FCRA 623 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), you are prohibited from furnishing information that you know or should know is in
accurate. Additionally, upon receiving a dispute, you must conduct a reasonable investigation under FCRA 623 ( b ) and report the results to all consumer reporting agencies to whom you furnished the information. If you can not verify these alleged delinquencies with complete and reliable documentation, you must promptly notify all agencies to delete or correct the information. 

Your failure to accurately report, verify, or correct the information may constitute violations of U.S. federal consumer protection laws, including those prohibiting deceptive or unfair practices. Furthermore, these errors and failures may violate New Jersey state laws, including the New Jersey Consumer Fraud Act ( N.J.S.A. 56:8-1 et seq. ), which prohibits fraudulent, deceptive, or unconscionable business practices related to consumer accounts, credit reporting, and the transmission of inaccurate or misleading data. 

I request that you provide written confirmation of the results of your investigation, including documentation supporting any claim of delinquency, the identity of any party you verify information with, and confirmation that you have notified all consumer reporting agencies of any corrections or deletions. If your investigation can not support the reporting beyond doubt, the information must be removed from all credit files where it appears.
Company public response: Company believes complaint represents an opportunity for improvement to better serve consumers

Sub-product: Home equity loan or line of credit (HELOC)
Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern at the CFPB, I am submitting this letter as a formal complaint and dispute regarding predatory and deceptive lending and servicing practices by Shellpoint Mortgage Servicing ( dba Newrez LLC ), which acquired our second mortgage from XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX  ). Shellpoint is currently threatening foreclosure and issuance of a Notice of Default based on an inaccurate and disputed loan balance. 

Our original second mortgage, originated in XX/XX/XXXX, was for {$88000.00} with a 20-year maturity. We made all payments on time for the first seven years. During the housing crisis, we were advised to temporarily suspend payments on both our first and second mortgages in order to pursue a loan modification. While a modification was granted on the first mortgage, XXXX denied a modification on the second loan. 

In XXXX, XXXX threatened foreclosure. In response, on XX/XX/XXXX, we wired a lump-sum payment of {$53000.00} to bring the account current. We were explicitly advised that this payment would cover all past-due payments, late fees, and penalty fees. Since that date, we have continued to make all required payments on time. 

Despite this, Shellpoint is now demanding a payoff of {$84000.00}, claiming the loan has reached maturity. This demand is unreasonable, unsupported, and mathematically indefensible. After seven years of on-time payments, followed by a lump-sum payment exceeding {$53000.00}, and continued timely payments thereafter, Shellpoint claims that only {$3500.00} has been applied to principal. Based on these facts, this loan should be paid off or carry a minimal remaining balance, not an amount approaching the original loan value. As of XX/XX/XXXX, Shellpoint has put a stop payment on the account not allowing us to make any payments. 

In addition, Shellpoint has engaged in repeated misrepresentations and servicing errors, including but not limited to : Falsely claiming to be in first lien position, when the loan is clearly a second mortgage. 
Improperly impounding our account for homeowners insurance, despite the fact that we have maintained continuous insurance coverage for over 20 years through our first mortgage servicer. 
Repeatedly disputing proof of insurance even after we have uploaded valid documentation multiple times. 
Misrepresenting that they lack our contact information, which has remained unchanged for over 20 years ( address, email addresses, and phone numbers ). 
Falsely stating that management could not return our calls for seven business days due to the law, a claim that appears to be entirely fabricated.

Failing to provide a complete and accurate accounting under the Real Estate Settlement Procedures Act ( RESPA ) from the loans origination in XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  through the present, despite multiple requests. 
This loan has been sold and transferred multiple times since origination, yet Shellpoint has failed to provide a lawful, transparent, and complete payment history or justification for the balance they are demanding. 

Shellpoint is now threatening a Notice of Default unless we immediately pay {$84000.00}, an amount we formally dispute as inaccurate and unsupported. Their actions constitute predatory lending and servicing practices, and we believe they are attempting to collect funds that are not legally owed. 

We respectfully request the CFPBs assistance in investigating this matter and holding Shellpoint Mortgage Servicing ( Newrez LLC ) accountable for these actions. We are seeking a full and accurate accounting, correction of the loan balance, cessation of foreclosure threats, and resolution of this matter in compliance with federal and state law.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law

Consumer complaint narrative: I was charged an extra mortgage payment in the month of XXXX due to bi-weekly payment that hit my bank account 3 times when the new mortgage company took over ( XX/XX/XXXX {$3500.00}, XX/XX/XXXX {$1700.00}, XX/XX/XXXX {$1700.00} ). I was given a refund of {$3500.00}, but later inform that the refund was pulled from an " '' Escrow Disbursement '' fund, in which I had to pay back. Therefore, on XX/XX/24, my mortgage payments increased from {$3500.00} to {$3700.00}, bi-weekly {$1700.00} to {$1800.00}. To make matters worse, the mortgage company tried to justify the escrow account by coming up with all kinds of excuses to not refund me my money.... they said I missed payments, didn't provide proof of insurance, didn't qualify for escrow, etc. Needless to say, this is wrong on so many level and has gone on far too long, over a year of calls and complaints, which has taken a toll on my finances & my mental health. If this request doesn't resolve my issue, I will seek legal counsel.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

I spoke with XXXX different reps from XXXX XX/XX/year> the XXXX XX/XX/year> regarding this issue I was told XXXX different lies .. Newrez Mortgage LLC reps used stall tactics and flat out lies in trying not to refund my money.. I am a 100 % permanently and totally XXXXXXXX XXXX .. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX to used that as a stall tactic and reason for not refunding and withholding funds from my escrow account. Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue while managing or servicing your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
Good Morning, I am responding to Complaint ID XXXX. I have attempted multiple times to submit feedback through your online portal, but the page would not load, so I am resubmitting my concerns in writing regarding the broader issue with our escrow analysis and monthly payment increase. 

During the period when Shellpoint enforced force-placed wind coverage, our normal monthly payment was {$8300.00}. The annual force-placed insurance charges were : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : {$14000.00} XXXX XXXX XXXX : {$4300.00} Now Shellpoint is claiming that our new monthly payment will exceed {$10000.00}, which does not make sense based on our current numbers. 

Current Loan Figures New insurance policy ( effective XX/XX/2025 ) : {$9600.00} annually Principal & Interest payment : {$4700.00} per month Current escrow payment : {$2400.00} per month ( = {$29000.00} annually ) 2025 Property Taxes : {$10000.00} Even if Shellpoint is claiming an escrow shortage and requesting an additional {$850.00} per month ( = {$10000.00} annually ), the numbers still do not align.

PITI Calculation Based on our principal, interest, taxes, and insurance, our total monthly payment should be approximately {$6300.00}, not over {$10000.00} per month.

Additional Concerns Collecting {$2400.00} per month plus {$850.00} per month equals {$39000.00} annually, which is far higher than the combined taxes and insurance required. This does not factor in credits already applied to the account fo
r XXXX and XX/XX/2025. 

The escrow account appears to still include charges for lender-placed hazard insurance, even though we have provided proof of coverage. 

Formal Request I am requesting a written explanation and a detailed escrow breakdown showing exactly how Shellpoint arrived at the new monthly payment amount, including : Itemized escrow calculation taxes, insurance, and all other components. 

Confirmation of removal of all force-placed insurance charges after XX/XX/2025. 

Calculation supporting the additional {$850.00} per month escrow collection. 

This appears to be a serious violation of escrow accounting standards, and I question how such over-collection can be allowed without proper regulatory oversight. 

On XX/XX/2025 at XXXX XXXX  Eastern, I spoke with XXXX, who confirmed the call was recorded. I strongly encourage Shellpoint leadership to review this call and use it as a training opportunity, as XXXX was unable to answer basic questions about my escrow account and monthly payment calculations. 

I have included detailed communications from my insurance agent, which clearly show that Shellpoint has failed to take responsibility for correcting its servicing errors. 

Please review this matter urgently and provide a written response and corrected escrow analysis as soon as possible. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this issue.
Company public response: Company believes complaint represents an opportunity for improvement to better serve consumers

Correct and we XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Shellpoint representatives admitted that a XXXX XXXX  payment existed in unapplied status, contradicted themselves about its destination, and then erased a previously confirmed XXXX XXXX  unapplied balance.
The same call captured two separate employees describing entirely different account realities within minutes of each other.

Evidence (verbatim excerpts):

I do see there was a balance in the unapplied of XXXX XXXXOK yes, I dont see that  it was about XXXX XXXX  applied yesterday.
SupervisorXXXX XXXX XXXX theres another payment that was made  that put your unapplied balance at XXXX XXXX completing XXXX payment.

Each statement conflicts with the others. The first recognizes an unapplied payment; the second claims the funds were applied yesterday; the third insists the same payment completed XXXX  a month already paid through prior remittances.

Interpretation:
This sequence demonstrates a systemic data-integrity failure rather than a single mis-keyed entry.
Shellpoints staff are reading from live account screens that change while the customer is on the line  meaning the ledger is being rewritten in real time to reconcile internal errors or conceal unapplied balances.
Such volatility violates:
		RESPA  1024.38(b)(3)(i)  failure to maintain accurate and accessible records.
		RESPA  1024.35(a)  servicer notice of error (were a little confused) triggers investigation duty.
		TILA  1026.36(c)(1)  failure to credit payments as of date received.
		Bankruptcy Code  524(i)  post-discharge tampering with payment application.

The conflicting explanations  unapplied, applied yesterday, completed XXXX   confirm ledger re-aging and manual overrides.
No servicer could produce three mutually exclusive account states unless data are being altered outside ordinary automated posting rules.

Risk Impact:
This behavior shows a system-level vulnerability where borrower payments can be suspended, moved backward to earlier months, or erased without audit transparency.
The XXXX XXXX call provides a living snapshot of that process: funds appear in the system, vanish, then reappear labeled applied, enabling Shellpoint to (1) fabricate delinquency, (2) assess late fees and inspection charges, and (3) justify foreclosure notices while still holding consumer money.
Such conduct jeopardizes compliance with federal servicing standards and exposes investors and borrowers to material misrepresentation of cash-flow integrity.



Systemic Alignment

The same mis-allocation pattern appears across every month since XXXX XXXX		payments first recorded as unapplied,
		later re-aged to prior months,
		followed by fee creation and conflicting balances.

This repetition confirms a servicing algorithm or manual policy, not human error.
Shellpoints own agents admitted confusion (thats why I think Im a little confused) because their interface dis"

Consumer complaint narrative:
My mortgage is currently XXXX months past due, and I am requesting mortgage assistance so that I can bring my account current. I believe my servicer has mishandled my loss mitigation application, provided inconsistent and incorrect information, and caused unnecessary delays that have placed me at risk of further delinquency. 

I lost my job on XX/XX/year>. I immediately notified my mortgage company and applied for mortgage assistance. At that time, I was receiving severance pay and later unemployment benefits. I was instructed to complete certain loss mitigation paperwork, which I did promptly. 

Initially, I was told that because I was unemployed, I would not need to submit additional documentation. This later turned out to be incorrect. I was subsequently advised that I needed to submit my unemployment award letter and bank statements, which I provided as requested. 

I spoke with a representative named XXXX, who told me that my application was going to be approved. That statement was not accurate. Approximately XXXX week later, I received an email stating that my application was denied. When I contacted the mortgage company for clarification, I was told that I was denied because I did not have a job and that my hardship would need to be over before assistance could be approved. I was never informed of this requirement during the application process. 

I then informed the servicer that my husband is employed and able to take over the mortgage payments. I was instructed to submit additional documentation, including : My husbands bank statements A non-contributor form My unemployment award letter The loss mitigation award letter I submitted all of the requested documents via email to XXXX, and I also mailed the complete application and bank statements to Shellpoint. 

When I followed up again with XXXX, I was told that the documents could not be accepted because XXXX was not written on the paperwork. I was also told that the documents were never received, despite submitting them multiple times via email and mail. 

As a result of these repeated issues, delays, and contradictory information, my mortgage is now XXXX months past due. I made a payment of {$2200.00} in XXXX in an effort to catch up, but I continue to struggle because : Documents are repeatedly claimed to be missing New errors are identified after submission I am told approvals are forthcoming and then later denied Denials are issued based on hardship criteria that were never previously disclosed I believe my servicer has failed to properly process my loss mitigation application, failed to provide clear and consistent guidance, and failed to act in good faith. I am requesting immediate review of my account, proper consideration for mortgage assistance, and a resolution that allows me to bring my loan current without further harm caused by servicing errors.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law

I do have a letter from them stating that my escrow accounts we cancelled and I could not reinstate them. I get a new bill from them with escrow charges added on for my taxes. I tried to call today, XXXX, but could not speak with anyone because they told me my mailing address I was providing was not the address on the bill. I am not sure how that can be when I have the bill I just received in my hand with that very address. 

So they incorrectly paid the first installment of my property taxes, which I already paid, even though I don't have an escrow account with them AND I can't talk to them about it because they claim that the mailing address in their records is not the one they just mailed me my bill to. 
I need help rectifying the escrow issue and I need to have a way to contact them.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
In XX/XX/XXXX, our area ( XXXX, XXXX, and the surrounding communities ) was struck by a tornado and declared a federal disaster area. As a result, we qualified for creditor relief. We contacted Shellpoint and were granted a six-month forbearance. The terms were explained to us, and we complied fully.

Per instructions from your staff, we called several weeks before the forbearance ended to confirm the process of moving the six months of payments to the end of the loan. We were told to resume payments in XXXX. When we attempted to make that payment both online and by phone, on multiple occasions we were informed by your representatives that no payment was due. We repeated this process in XXXX and XXXX, receiving the same response each time. Your staff consistently reassured us that no payment was due until XXXX. 

In XXXX, we made our regular payment on time, as we always have. For context, we have only used forbearance twice : once during XXXX and once after this tornado disaster. In both cases, we carefully followed the rules provided to us. 

Despite this, Shellpoint has reported us as delinquent for three months, causing our credit scores ( previously above XXXX ) to drop by more than XXXX points. After speaking with several representatives, I finally learned that Shellpoints system would not allow payment acceptance while the request to move payments to the end of the loan was still processing. However, this was never communicated to us at the time, and we were repeatedly assured no payments were due. 

This error is entirely the result of Shellpoints handling of the forbearance process, not our actions. My wife XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and I have contacted Shellpoint for over XXXX months now, attempting to resolve this matter, yet the false reporting remains and continues. In XX/XX/XXXX, after calling, we were trasnfered to XXXX XXXX ( Loss Mitigation Supervisor NMLS ID # XXXX ). She assurred us of her assistnace. Our last communicton with her was XX/XX/XXXX, via email. There has been no follow up communication since. 

We are outraged and deeply frustrated. We have an impeccable payment history outside of the approved forbearances, and this negative reporting is unjust, damaging, and should be corrected immediately if nothing else, in good faith. 

I respectfully demand that Shellpoint urgently review this matter and correct the inaccurate reporting to the credit bureaus. This situation is unfair, not of our making, and can not be allowed to continue. As of XX/XX/XXXX, this information has been reviesed and reported multiple times, dropping my XXXX score XXXX points on multiple occasions. 

I fully complied with all terms of that forbearance. When the forbearance ended in XXXX, I attempted to resume payments, but Shellpoint representatives informed me that payments could not yet be accepted until the forbearance was fully processed and applied to the back of the loan. My payments were ultimately received and accepted in XX/XX/XXXX. 



Because the delayed payment acceptance was due to XXXX internal processing and not borrower negligence, the XX/XX/XXXX late notation is inaccurate and unfairly reported.

Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue while managing or servicing your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have a mortgage that was recently sold to NewRez. I am a new customer still working on establishing my account. I noticed an issue with a payment this morning, went to the " contact us '' section of the app, and called the phone number. My call was redirected to the " rewards and savings '' line. They offered me a {$100.00} voucher to be sent to my home if I could just provide them my credit card information for a {$1.00} shipping and handling charge. Normally, this is where I hang up the phone ( I know when I'm being scammed ). But I was confused because I called the number provided in the app for NewRez. They didn't call me. I double checked my most recent paper bill, and I had the correct number. I XXXX " NewRez phone number '' and was directed to the FAQ page that listed this same number. The number is XXXX. 

After searching for longer, I found a new phone number listed in XXXX XXXX  on the NewRez website : XXXX. I called this number and listened to an automated voice tell me I can " call NewRez directly at XXXX '' ( the old phone number ). When I was finally connected to a legit NewRez employee, they cited the new phone number and said they had no knowledge of what I was talking about and no knowledge of a recent phone number change. 

This is a predatory business practice. I am guessing NewRez is not associated with the phone number anymore, but it is 100 % their responsibility to announce this to their customers. They are still listing a scam phone number in several places on their website, app, and in their automated phone system. This number has been printed on paper bills and saved in people 's phones. Their customers are calling this number thinking they are reaching a legitimate company, providing personal and financial information in trust, and then getting taken advantage of

I told her that's not the case, I have a minimum threshold of {$2500.00} and I can't use that. She insisted that I could and said go ahead. I was thankful, needed it as I'm going through a lot of financial issues. I wrote the check, paid XXXX bills, then it was returned to Shellpoint because of what I said. Threshold was {$2500.00}. All my bills were returned unpaid, bank fees on all AND fees with the merchants I owed money to. Fees were well over {$300.00}. The domino effect took over for all other bills that were due now that the account was overdrawn from the return check. I am a single woman, every dollar counts and this threw me into a tailspin. I immediately called, started recording calls. They admitted the mistake and did nothing about it. I sent XXXX emails, they took 6 months to tell me they were wrong but not going to honor allowing the {$670.00} again as an exception. 6 MONTHS to tell me that AND tell me I had to submit bank records for fees. I had to close that checking account with all the issues, could not access anymore. I sent a letter in writing earlier this month ( XXXX ) asking in good faith once and for all for minimum of {$150.00} for fees ( XXXX of what I was charged ) No resolution still. Also, made another plea to reconsider the {$670.00}. NOTHING. This seems small, but the turmoil has been tremendous. Their response times are horrific and never resolving.I was not only going through a potential XXXX XXXX situation, having medical procedures not covered, large repairs in my home taking place, and this company could not resolve less than {$1000.00} for their mistake.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Newrez, LLC, d.b.a Shellpoint wrongfully purchased two separate flood insurance policies on my behalf, falsely reported missed mortgage payments to credit bureaus, assessed late fees and caused other financial losses ; additionally, caused me emotional distress, anxiety and humiliation.

As a result of Newrez/Shellpoint 's purchase of two flood insurance policies my escrow account lacked sufficient funds, so Newrez/Shellpoint increased my monthly mortgage payment. Newrez/Shellpoint increased my monthly mortgage payment by {$140.00}, from {$990.00} to {$1100.00}, to compensate for the escrow impound account shortfall.

I have maintained the same valid flood insurance policy on a continuous and uninterrupted basis from the date I purchased my home until the present. 

On XX/XX/XXXX and again on XX/XX/XXXX, Newrez/Shellpoint purchased separate flood insurance policies on my behalf. Defendant mistakenly believed that hazard insurance and flood insurance must be in separate policies, however, my hazard and flood coverage are set forth in a single policy with XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX ). 

I have filed complaints with two government agencies because of Newrez/Shellpoint 's , and a prior mortgage service providers, attempts to wrongfully purchase lender placed flood insurance.

MY first complaint was lodged with the California Department of Financial Protection and Innovation ( CDFI ) against my former mortgage service provider, Specialized Loan Servicing ( SLS ). As a result of SLSs self-investigation, the company responded as follows : -Our records showed XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX  as your homeowners insurance carrier with flood insurance included -Our record inadvertently showed that flood insurance was not included in homeowners policy. 
-We updated our records to show flood insurance is included in your homeowners insurance policy -a Lender Placed Insurance was not purchased -We Apologize for any inconvenience My second complaint was lodged with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) against Newrez/Shellpoint. Newrez/Shellpoint responded to the CFPB with false statements including : Upon researching the issue, we determined that at the time your loan was acquired by Newrez your loan boarded with an expired flood insurance policy on file with an expiration date of XX/XX/XXXX. Newrez/Shellpoint 's statements to the CFPB were know by Newrez/Shellpoint to be false and were intended to fraudulently deceive, distract, and misdirect the CFPB in their investigation of Plaintiff 's complaint, and to defuse any accusations of fault attributed to Newrez/Shellpoint. 

In conjunction to my complaint to the CFPB, on XX/XX/XXXX I filed in XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX an Amended Claim and Order to Go to Small Claims Court ( XXXX ) and Motion for Exemplary Damages. Myself and Newrez/Shellpoint later resolved that case, prior to trial, by executing a Confidential Settlement Agreement.

Newrez/Shellpoint has since breached the agreement by falsely asserting I have failed to make mortgage payments. Consumer complaint narrative:

This fax is transmitted to preserve the record, document continued noncompliance, and ensure proper receipt by the XXXX Department. 

This matter is time-sensitive. 
Please acknowledge receipt by email. 

SENT BY : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Illinois XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : XXXX Phone : XXXX To : SHELLPOINT MORTGAGE SERVICING XXXX DEPARTMENT XXXX XXXX XXXX, SC XXXX FAX : XXXX RESPA QWR REBUTTAL SHELLPOINT MORTGAGE SERVICING Subject : CFPB Rebuttal Shellpoint Mortgage Servicing : Pattern of Contradictory and Misleading Responses ( XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX ) Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX Team Re XXXX CFPB XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Servicer : NewRez LLC XXXX Shellpoint Mortgage Servicing Borrower : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX Illinois To Whom It May Concern XXXX This submission is a formal rebuttal to Shellpoint Mortgage Servicings most recent response dated XX/XX/XXXX, authored by XXXX XXXX, XXXX Department, and to Shellpoints XXXX written responses submitted to the Illinois Department of Financial and Professional Regulation ( IDFPR ) on XX/XX/XXXX, and to the CFPB on XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX. 
Shellpoints responses, taken together, demonstrate a pattern of contradictory factual assertions, selective disclosures, and evasive disclaimers, all issued by the same compliance agent despite repeated notice of document defects and inconsistencies. These defects were never cured prior to foreclosure and sheriffs sale. 


I. Same Compliance Agent, Repeated After Notice All XXXX responses ( XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, and XX/XX/XXXX ) were authored or affirmed by XXXX XXXX on behalf of Shellpoints XXXX Department. As a result : Shellpoint can not claim lack of knowledge, clerical error, or misunderstanding. 
Repetition of disputed statements after notice constitutes knowing adoption of those statements. 
This establishes a pattern, not an isolated mistake. 

XXXX. Contradictory and Misleading Origination Assertions In the XX/XX/XXXX, response, Shellpoint states : This loan originated with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX. 
However, Shellpoint has been repeatedly notified that : There are multiple mortgage versions associated with this loan ; XXXX version was reprinted and recorded after the Note ; The Note and Mortgage do not match ; The XX/XX/XXXX, mortgage is the disputed and altered instrument. 
Shellpoints continued assertion of a single undisputed origination datewithout addressing the existence of conflicting instrumentsmisrepresents the record and improperly adopts a contested document as controlling. 

XXXX. Admission of a Fatal NoteMortgage Discrepancy Shellpoint again admits in its XX/XX/XXXX response : XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX and you signed the Mortgage However, XXXX XXXX name does not appear on the Note. 
This is not explanatory ; it is an admission that : The Mortgage encumbers the property using a party not obligated on the debt ; The Note and Mortgage are nonconforming ; Foreclosure proceeded on mismatched collateral documents. 
None of Shellpoints responses reconcile this defect, despite acknowledging it across multiple submissions. 

XXXX. Improper Reliance on QWR Scope to Avoid Substantive Answers Across its responses, Shellpoint repeatedly claims that inquiries regarding origination, document integrity, or chain of title fall outside the scope of a Qualified Written Request ( QWR ). 
This position is misapplied where : The servicer is actively enforcing the loan ; The servicer is relying on specific documents to collect payments and foreclose ; The borrower disputes the accuracy of servicing records and instruments used to service the loan. 
Shellpoint can not simultaneously enforce disputed documents and disclaim responsibility for their accuracy. 
Since XX/XX/XXXX, Shellpoint has failed to produce the servicing records expressly requested in my Qualified Written Requests under 12 C.F.R. 1024.351024.36, including but not limited to the full life-of-loan payment and escrow ledgers ; master servicing and sub-servicer transaction logs ; investor, trust, and remittance ledgers identifying all entities receiving or crediting payments ; the complete collateral file and identification of the current document custodian ; all servicing transfer and boarding records ; proof of ownership and authority to enforce the note and mortgage as of the date the foreclosure complaint was filed ; written explanations for each loan number associated with the account ; and a complete accounting and justification for all post-filing fees and charges assessed. This failure also includes Shellpoints refusal to reconcile or substantiate its admitted discrepancy that XXXX XXXX appears as a signatory on the recorded Mortgage but not on the Note, including the absence of any signed debt instrument evidencing his liability, authentic signature affidavits, notary journals or certifications for XX/XX/XXXX, or identification of any party who added or authorized his name post-closing. Instead, Shellpoint has issued only generic validation-of-debt correspondence, mischaracterized the scope of my requests, and deferred its statutory obligations. 

XXXX. Inconsistent Disclaimers of Knowledge While Enforcing the Loan In the XX/XX/XXXX response, Shellpoint states it does not have knowledge of the loan closing or other aspects of the loan unrelated to servicing, while also asserting detailed factual narratives regarding origination, borrower identity, payment history, and foreclosure authority. 
This is internally inconsistent. Once Shellpoint : Collected payments ; Evaluated loss mitigation; Referred the loan to foreclosure counsel ; Scheduled and completed a foreclosure sale ; it assumed responsibility for verifying the validity of the instruments it relied upon. 

XXXX. Improper Identity Theft Burden-Shifting Shellpoint now demands photo identification, a Social Security card , notarized affidavits, and a police report as a precondition to investigating fraud. 
My dispute does not allege random identity theft. It alleges : Document fabrication and alteration ; Non-matching loan instruments ; Fraudulent adoption of defective documents in servicing and foreclosure. 
Requiring law-enforcement reports under these circumstances is coercive, improper, and inconsistent with consumer protection standards. 

XXXX. Foreclosure Proceeded Despite Active, Unresolved Disputes Shellpoint acknowledges that : CFPB and IDFPR complaints were active ; Multiple written disputes were pending ; Document inconsistencies were never resolved ; Yet it proceeded with foreclosure and sheriffs sale while recycling the same disputed factual assertions. This reflects willful noncompliance and bad-faith servicing. 

XXXX. Requested CFPB Action I respectfully request that the CFPB : Reject Shellpoints XX/XX/XXXX, response as non-responsive and misleading ; Require Shellpoint to reconcile its contradictory statements across XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, and XX/XX/XXXX ; Compel Shellpoint to identify which mortgage and note it relied upon to foreclose, and why ; Escalate this matter for supervisory review, given the repeated misrepresentations by the same compliance agent ; Preserve this rebuttal as part of the official CFPB record. 
Shellpoints responses demonstrate a clear pattern of contradiction, evasion, and reliance on disputed instruments. The XX/XX/XXXX submission does not cure these defectsit compounds them. 

Respectfully submitted, XXXX XXXX XXXX/ Complainant Date : XX/XX/XXXX 2025

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this complaint against Shellpoint Mortgage Servicing ( Shellpoint/NewRez LLC d/b/a Shellpoint Mortgage Servicing ) for repeated violations of federal and state consumer protection laws in handling my first-lien residential mortgage ( Loan # XXXX, secured by my primary residence at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, CA XXXX ) . These violations include improper and rushed denials of loan modification applications, dual tracking ( advancing foreclosure proceedings while reviewing complete applications ), failure to validate a disputed debt, false or misleading representations about application status, inconsistent assignment of a Single Point of Contact ( SPOC ), and harassing collection tactics that have caused severe emotional distress. Shellpoint 's conduct has forced me to file a lawsuit in XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX. XXXX, filed XX/XX/year> ) seeking declaratory relief, cancellation of instruments, slander of title, HBOR violations, UCL violations ( Bus. & Prof. Code 17200 ), intentional infliction of emotional distress, and accounting. I am also considering XXXX XXXX bankruptcy to address this and other debts. Below is a detailed chronological account, with references to attached evidence. 
XX/XX/year> Loan Modification Application : In XX/XX/year>, I submitted a complete application for loan modification due to financial hardship making payments difficult. Shellpoint acknowledged the application as complete in writing via email from my assigned SPOC, XXXX XXXX ( Loss Mitigation Specialist ). However, shortly thereafter, Shellpoint issued a Notice of Default ( NOD ) and continued foreclosure proceedings. My SPOC advised me in writing to " ignore '' the NOD, implying the modification review would halt the foreclosure. This was misleading, as the foreclosure advanced anyway. This constitutes dual tracking, prohibited under the Real Estate Settlement Procedures Act ( RESPA, 12 C.F.R. 1024.41 ( c ) ), which bars servicers from advancing foreclosure ( e.g., recording notices or scheduling sales ) while evaluating a complete loss mitigation application submitted at least 37 days before a scheduled sale. It also violates the California Homeowner Bill of Rights ( HBOR, Cal. Civ. Code 2923.6 ), which prohibits dual tracking for complete first-lien modification applications. Shellpoint did not provide a 5-business-day acknowledgment specifying any missing information or give me 30 days to supplement if incomplete ( RESPA 1024.41 ( b ) ( 2 ) ). No appeal opportunity was offered before denial. 
XX/XX/year> : Inconsistent SPOC Assignment : On XX/XX/year>, XXXX XXXX emailed me stating, " I am no longer your single point of contact. Please call XXXX. Any representative here may assist you '' ( see attached " XXXX XXXX XXXX '' ). This violated RESPA 1024.40, which requires servicers to assign and maintain a consistent SPOC to handle borrower inquiries and loss mitigation options without confusion. Despite this, when I called Shellpoint on XX/XX/year>, representatives informed me that XXXX XXXX was still my SPOC, leading to further inconsistency and frustration ( see attached " XXXX XXXX '' ). 
XX/XX/year> : Debt Dispute and Cease and Desist : On XX/XX/year>, I sent Shellpoint a cease and desist letter disputing the alleged debt amount ( {$160000.00} in arrears ) and demanding full validation ( e.g., original promissory note, complete payment history, chain of assignments ) under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA, 15 U.S.C. 1692g ). Shellpoint identifies itself as a " debt collector '' in all communications, including email disclaimers ( e.g., " This communication is from a debt collector '' in attached emails from XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX ). Despite my timely dispute, Shellpoint has failed to provide validation and continued collection activities, including foreclosure advancement. This violates FDCPA 1692g ( a ) ( requiring validation notice ) and 1692g ( b ) ( requiring cessation of collection until debt is verified ). 
XXXX XXXX XXXX : Second Loan Modification Application and Improper Denial : On XX/XX/year>, I emailed XXXX XXXX seeking assistance due to ongoing hardship : " Good morning I called and they told me you are my spoc '' ( attached " XXXX XXXX '' ). On XX/XX/year> ( XXXX XXXX  ), she responded, " Thank you for reaching out. Im sorry to hear about your situation. Please advise what type of assistance you are looking for. '' Later that day ( around XXXX XXXX  ), I submitted a full loan modification application. Shellpoint acknowledged it as complete in writing : " We have received your complete application for loss mitigation assistance. No additional documents are needed at this time '' ( attached " XXXX '' ). 
Despite this acknowledgment, XXXX XXXX verbally denied the application on the same day ( XX/XX/year> ), and Shellpoint issued a formal written denial letter on XX/XX/year> ( attached " Denial letter.pdf '' ). Denial reasons included " insufficient hardship info, '' loan exceeding delinquency limits, failed Net Present Value ( NPV ) test, and reaching the maximum number of modifications allowed. This denial occurred just 2 days after acknowledgment, without a 5-business-day acknowledgment notice specifying issues ( RESPA 1024.41 ( b ) ( 2 ) ), without identifying any missing documents, and without giving me 30 days to supplement if deemed incomplete. Shellpoint treated the application as complete enough for review but denied it without proper process, violating RESPA 1024.41 ( c ) - ( d ) ( requiring full evaluation of complete applications and 30-day appeal rights ) and HBOR 2923.6 ( prohibiting denial without appeal opportunity and dual tracking during review/appeal ) .

The denial also contained false or misleading representations : If hardship information was " insufficient, '' Shellpoint should have notified me as incomplete and allowed correction, not proceeded to a merits denial. This violates FDCPA 1692e, which prohibits false, deceptive, or misleading representations in connection with debt collection.

Ongoing Foreclosure Advancement and Harassment ( XXXX XXXX ) : Despite the complete XX/XX/XXXX application and my 30-day appeal window ( ending approximately XX/XX/year> ), Shellpoint advanced foreclosure through XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX , with a trustee sale originally scheduled for XX/XX/year>. This is a clear dual tracking violation under RESPA 1024.41 and HBOR 2923.6 ( c ), as no notice of sale or trustee 's sale can proceed while a complete application is pending review or appeal. On XX/XX/year>, I called XXXX XXXX and spoke to XXXX, who verbally postponed the sale to XX/XX/year>, but I have not yet received written confirmation, creating ongoing uncertainty.

Shellpoint 's overall patternrushed denials without process, ignored debt disputes, inconsistent SPOC, misleading statements, and persistent foreclosure pressure despite violationsconstitutes harassing or abusive collection practices under FDCPA 1692d. This has caused me severe emotional distress ( e.g., XXXX, sleep disturbances, as detailed in my state court complaint ),
unnecessary legal expenses, and forced consideration of XXXX XXXX  bankruptcy when proper handling could have resolved this. 
Shellpoint 's actions appear willful and reckless, especially after my cease and desist letter. I have attached all supporting evidence, including emails from XXXX XXXX ( dated XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX ), the denial letter ( XX/XX/XXXX ), cease and desist ( XX/XX/XXXX ), acknowledgment of complete application ( " XXXX '' ), email from XXXX ( if applicable, attached " email from XXXX '' ), and my verified state court complaint ( 139-page XXXX  filed XX/XX/year> ).

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
This complaint is directed against NR/SMS/CAL , a data furnisher and collection entity that has violated multiple provisions of the FAIR CREDIT REPORTING ACT ( 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq. ), the FAIR DEBT COLLECTION PRACTICES ACT ( 15 U.S.C. 1692 et seq. ), and applicable state consumer protection laws, by reporting and verifying inaccurate, unverifiable, and obsolete information to the nationwide credit reporting agencies XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 

NR/SMS/CAL has continued to furnish negative information regarding an alleged account without providing validation of debt, documentary proof of ownership or assignment, or verification of reporting accuracy as required by law. This constitutes both federal violations and reckless noncompliance with Metro 2 data furnishing standards. 

ACCOUNT IN QUESTION NR/SMS/CAL Account Number : XXXX Date Opened : XX/XX/XXXX Reported Balance : {$3100.00} Summary of Issue : The above-referenced account appears as a collection or charge-off tradeline across multiple credit reports. However, the consumer has never received documentation verifying the alleged debt, original creditor, date of delinquency, or any contract binding the consumer to the reported obligation. 

Further, NR/SMS/CAL has verified this disputed tradeline with the credit bureaus without conducting a meaningful investigation, in direct violation of FCRA 623 ( b ). The companys continued reporting of unverifiable and outdated data violates federal standards for accuracy, integrity, and procedural compliance.

VIOLATIONS Federal Violations : FCRA 602 ( A ) : Congressional intent mandates accurate and fair reporting ; NR/SMS/CALs conduct undermines this standard. 

FCRA 607 ( b ) : Failure to ensure maximum possible accuracy of consumer information before and after disputes.

FCRA 623 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) : Furnishing information known or reasonably expected to be inaccurate.

FCRA 623 ( b ) ( 1 ) : Failing to investigate and correct disputed information after notification from a credit reporting agency.

FDCPA 807 ( 2 ) ( A ) : False representation of the character, amount, or legal status of a debt.

FDCPA 809 ( b ) : Failure to cease collection and validate debt upon written dispute from the consumer.

FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) : Failure to provide supporting documentation or verification during dispute reinvestigation. 

Metro 2 and Regulatory Violations : CDIA METRO 2 COMPLIANCE MANUAL ( 2023 ) : Prohibits the use of unverifiable or unvalidated data fields, mandates proper coding for paid or disputed accounts, and forbids the transmission of duplicate or incomplete consumer data.

12 CFR 1022.42 ( a ) : Requires data furnishers to maintain policies and procedures for the accuracy and integrity of information furnished to consumer reporting agencies.

State Law Violations ( Tennessee ) : TENNESSEE CONSUMER PROTECTION ACT ( T.C.A. 47-18-104 ) : Deceptive acts or practices in commerce, including false or misleading representations regarding debt.

TENNESSEE COLLECTION SERVICE ACT ( T.C.A. 62-20-114 ) : Unlawful to attempt to collect a debt without proper validation or documentation.

T.C.A. 47-18-109 ( a ) : Provides a private right of action for any person suffering ascertainable loss as a result of unfair or deceptive acts or practices.

PATTERN OF NONCOMPLIANCE NR/SMS/CAL has demonstrated a pattern of willful and negligent disregard for federal law by : Reporting an account without documentary proof of the debt or assignment. 

Failing to produce evidence upon receipt of a written dispute. 

Continuing to verify inaccurate information with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 

Using collection and reporting tactics that cause tangible harm to the consumers credit standing and emotional well-being. 

Such conduct constitutes a willful violation under FCRA 616 and a negligent violation under FCRA 617, subjecting the company to actual, statutory, and punitive damages.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX has now submitted a XXXX  and final Qualified Written Request ( QWR ) to NewRez LLC XXXX Shellpoint Mortgage Servicing, following XXXX prior QWRs sent in XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX, neither of which was lawfully acknowledged or substantively answered. 

The XXXX  and Final QWR was transmitted on XX/XX/XXXX, via certified mail to Shellpoints servicing offices in XXXX, North Carolina, and XXXX Washington, Pennsylvania, and was also transmitted electronically. Despite confirmed delivery, Shellpoint has failed to provide the required five-day acknowledgment and thirty-day substantive response mandated by RESPA and Regulation X . 

Instead of responding, Shellpoint has repeatedly issued generic, vague form letters stating that the request is complex and has been escalated, without identifying which QWR is being addressed, without invoking a lawful extension, and without producing any of the requested documents, corrections, or explanations. To date, none of the XXXX QWRs has been properly answered. 

Additionally, Shellpoint has sent certified packets containing only generic validation of debt materials and previously disputed documents, which do not satisfy RESPA requirements and do not address the specific servicing errors raised. 

The underlying servicing issues are serious and ongoing. XXXX materially different mortgage instruments exist in the record, each bearing different time and date stamps, and only XXXX reflects the actual borrowersXXXX XXXX and her late husband. The second, fraudulent version improperly adds XXXX disabled adult son, who never executed the mortgage or note. 

Shellpoint and related entities also relied on a purported Assignment of Mortgage executed nearly XXXX years after the loan was sold, created and notarized in Florida, and recorded in XXXX XXXX, Illinois on XX/XX/XXXX, just months before the foreclosure filing on XX/XX/XXXX. This assignment references a deceased individual and is inconsistent with public records, warehouse-lending confirmations, and MERS data previously submitted to CFPB and XXXX. 

Despite having received the borrowers death certificate, Shellpoint has continued to issue billing statements, IRS Forms XXXX, insurance charges, inspections, and appraisal fees under a fictitious borrower designation styled as an Estate, without probate authority or legal authorization. 

Taken together, these facts demonstrate a pattern of repeated RESPA violations, record misrepresentation, improper servicing conduct, and failure to correct known errors despite multiple verified notices. XXXX XXXX respectfully requests CFPB escalation, supervisory review, and confirmation of receipt of this XXXX and Final QWR submission. 
XXXX XXXX has now submitted XXXX ( XXXX ) separate Qualified Written Requests ( QWRs ) to NewRez LLC d/b/a Shellpoint Mortgage Servicing : XX/XX/XXXX ( received XX/XX/XXXX ) XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX ( Third and Final QWR ) Each QWR was properly transmitted via certified/overnight mail and email. None have been substantively acknowledged or answered in compliance with RESPA. 

Instead, Shellpoint has repeatedly sent generic, vague template letters stating that the requests are complex, under review, or escalated, without identifying which QWR is being addressed and without producing any of the requested records. These letters do not satisfy the XXXX acknowledgment or the XXXX response requirements under 12 U.S.C. 2605 ( e ) and 12 C.F.R. 1024.351024.36. 

Shellpoint has never provided : A life-of-loan payment ledger Servicing or master ledgers Proof of ownership or authority to enforce Custodial or bailee documentation for the original note A lawful explanation for multiple conflicting loan numbers Further, XXXX materially different mortgage instruments exist in the public record and have already been submitted to CFPB and IDFPR : Both contain different timestamps and formats The recorded version adds Marys autistic adult son as a borrower, despite never signing the note or mortgage Only XXXX and her late husband signed the original loan documents Shellpoint and/or NewRez also created a fraudulent Assignment of Mortgage nearly XXXX years after the loan was allegedly sold, executed and notarized in Florida, then recorded in XXXX XXXX, Illinois on XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX months before filing foreclosure on XX/XX/XXXX. 

Despite having received XXXX XXXX death certificate, Shellpoint : Reported IRS Forms XXXX under a fictitious Estate of XXXX XXXX Force-placed insurance Ordered XXXX unauthorized exterior-only appraisals Issued billing statements and charges under a nonexistent estate None of this went through probate, and Shellpoint was never granted authority to alter borrower identity.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am the homeowner at XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, GA XXXX. My mortgage is serviced by Shellpoint Mortgage Servicing. 

On XX/XX/year>, I requested a payoff statement so I could sell my home. Shellpoint claims they sent the payoff to the wrong email address, which caused delays and prevented my pending sale from closing. I also requested that they open up a short sale just in case the offer did not cover the arrears and penalties. I repeatedly asked Shellpoint and their foreclosure law firm ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ) for a corrected payoff and for the identity of the investor who owns my loan. Despite my requests, they refused to provide this information. 

On XX/XX/year>, I spoke with Shellpoint by phone and was told the foreclosure sale was postponed. Relying on that assurance, I continued working to resolve the payoff issue. However, on XX/XX/year>, Shellpoint went ahead and foreclosed on my home anyway, despite their prior representation that the sale had been delayed. 

I later learned that XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, as Owner Trustee for XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  may actually be the investor, but Shellpoint never disclosed this to me until weeks after the foreclosure.

Because of these actions, I lost my home, lost the opportunity to sell the property, and suffered severe financial and emotional harm. Shellpoints conduct sending the payoff to the wrong address, refusing to identify the investor, telling me the sale was postponed, and then foreclosing anyway is unfair, deceptive, and abusive.

I request that the CFPB investigate Shellpoint Mortgage Servicing and XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, require them to disclose the true investor, correct their records, and provide remedies for the wrongful foreclosure and the harm I have suffered.
